title: spanked
body:
A character that has been spanked (struck on the buttocks, with a bare hand or other object, for disciplinary or sexual reasons). This is usually indicated by  a red mark on their [[ass]], which may or may not be in the shape of a hand. General reddening of the [[ass]] also is indicative of spanking.

While commonly tagged alongside with [[spanking]], in cases where there is no active spanking occurring, the spanked tag should be used stand alone. 

h4. See also
* [[spanking]]
* [[bdsm]]
* [[slap mark]]
* [[paddle]]

title: knife
body:
A tool or [[weapon]] consisting of a short blade and a handle, used for cutting, stabbing, or slashing.

A knife can be a [[weapon]], such as a [[dagger]] or [[combat knife]], a utensil, such as a [[kitchen knife]] or [[butter knife]], or a tool, such as a pocket knife or a [[Swiss army knife]].

h4. Related tags

h6. Weapons

* !post #7913634: [[balisong]]/Butterfly knife
* !post #8663673: [[combat knife]]

h6. Utensils

* !post #8828305: [[butter knife]]: A spread knife that lacks a sharp edge. Primarily used to spread butter.
* !post #7792531: [[kitchen knife]]: A knife primarily used for preparing food. (There are multiple variations)
* !post #6672717: [[table knife]]: A moderately sharp knife used for dinning. Usually found paired with a fork.
* !post #8229816: [[santoku knife]]: A Japanese originating kitchen knife that has a curved end.
* !post #4703876: [[bread knife]]: A large serrated knife specialized to saw hard bread.
* !post #8364416: [[cleaver]]: A square like knife used for chopping meat.

title: shirakami_fubuki
body:
A [[Virtual YouTuber|VTuber]] and member of [[hololive]]'s [[1st generation (hololive)|]]. Also a member of [[hololive Gamers]]. Designed by [[Nagishiro Mito]]. On November 5th, 2020, Fubuki became the third member of hololive (after [[Gawr Gura]] and [[Inugami Korone]]) to reach 1 million subscribers on YouTube.

She is a white and black [[fox girl]] with [[fox ears]] with [[animal ear piercing|ear piercing]] on her left ear and a white and black-tipped [[fox tail]] with a [[pentagram]] inscription near the tip. She has [[aqua eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[white hair|white]] or [[grey hair|grey]] hair with an [[ahoge]] and [[double-parted bangs]] reaching [[hair between eyes|between her eyes]]. Her regular hairstyle consists of a [[low ponytail]] held with a [[black ribbon|black]] [[hair ribbon]], [[sidelocks]] and a [[side braid]].

title: sukonbu_(shirakami_fubuki)
body:
Mascots representing the fans of [[Shirakami Fubuki]], designed by [[shirakami fubuki (artist)|Fubuki]] herself.

They are tiny [[chibi]] white foxes with yellow tails surrounded by two green shrouds that, as a whole, resembles an ear of corn (maize), which is Fubuki's fan mark: 🌽. They also have Fubuki's earring and black inner ear fur and adds aqua facial streaks, three on the forehead and one on each cheek.

Depending on where they come from, the Sukonbu have different accessories assigned to them. The Sukonbu proper, the japanese fans, wear a scarf similar to Fubuki's in her original outfit. The "Friends", which are the foreign fans, wear ribbons similar to the one in Fubuki's lolita outfit. All of them have an accessory at the knot which resembles an orange X but is based on Gold Osmanthus blossoms.

That being said, Fubuki encourages her fans to personalize their Sukonbu avatars by adding or changing their accessories. They can also be given different eye colors other than simple black ovals, giving her green-blue eye color and Kurokami's red eye color as an example.

h4. Appearence

* !post #4545004: Reference sheet

title: irisviel_von_einzbern
body:
A homunculus coined by the Einzbern family based on the archetype of Lizleihi Justica von Einzbern, thus referred as a Justica-late model. 

The one who became the mother body of the ultimate homunculus, among all Einzbern homunculi in the past, she is the only one who experienced motherhood and gave birth to a successor. 

Loves [[Emiya Kiritsugu]], her husband, and [[Illyasviel von Einzbern]], her daughter.

A version of her wearing the Dress of Heaven is an event-related [[irisviel von einzbern (caster)|Caster-class Servant]] in [[Fate/Grand Order]].

title: emiya_kiritsugu_(assassin)
body:
Assassin-class Servant from [i][[Fate/Grand Order]][/i] introduced in the [[Fate/Accel Zero Order]] event.

He's [[Emiya Kiritsugu]] from a universe where the Einzbern House has not adopted the strategy of hiring an outside Master, making him not meet with the [[Irisviel von Einzbern|wife]] he was supposed to meet, and thus was neither separated from said wife nor suffered the frustration of such a separation. Yet, he still became a cold blooded assassin.

Has [[white hair]], [[dark-skinned male|dark skin]], and often conceals his face with bandages and hood. Attacks using [[throwing knife|throwing knives]], a close-combat [[knife]] and his trademark firearms ([[Thompson/Center Contender]] and [[Calico M950]]). Uses the Emiya crest and magecraft for his [[Noble Phantasm (fate)|]], Chronos Rose.

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Akira (kaned fools)|]]
[b]Voice Actor:[/b] [[Koyama Rikiya]]

title: comandante_cappellini_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Italian submarine [i]Comandante Cappellini[/i]. Character design by [[Jiji (aardvark)|]]. 

She has [[long hair|long]] [[pink hair]] tied into [[twintails]] and with an [[ahoge]], and [[green eyes]]. Her default outfit (representing her Italian service) consists of a [[black vest]], [[black shorts]] underneath a [[black skirt]], [[black thighhighs|black]] [[thigh boots]], and a [[green bow|green]] [[hair bow]]. As [[UIT-24 (kancolle)|]] she wears a [[black bow|black]] [[hair bow]], and as [[I-503 (Kancolle)|]] she wears a [[pink bow|pink]] [[hair bow]].

The historical [i]Comandante Cappellini[/i] was seized by the Japanese after the Italian surrender in 1943 and handed over to Germany as [i]UIT-24[/i]. She was seized back by the Japanese after the German surrender in 1945 and commissioned as [i]I-503[/i].

title: mechanical_buddy_universe
body:
[[post-apocalypse|Post-apocalyptic]] science fiction setting by [[Kato Takuji]] (AKA Ishiyumi). Most stories in the setting generally involve a human paired off with a sapient robot character as their primary protagonists.

Four main stories are set in this universe:

* "The Story of a Droid":[/pools/16987]
* "Hawkeye in Love":[/pools/17005] 
* "The Banshee Cometh":[/pools/17015] 
* "Maid Would Want to Protect Her Lady":[/pools/17016]

In addition there are the side stories "The Story of an Manga Artist":[/pools/17081], and "Apparition":[/pools/17021] which technically takes place in the same universe.

Currently serialized by Square Enix as [b]Mechanical Buddy Universe 1.0[/b].

h4. External links

* "Manga UP!: Mechanical Buddy Universe":https://global.manga-up.com/manga/234
* "Square Enix: Mechanical Buddy Universe 1.0":https://magazine.jp.square-enix.com/yg/introduction/meka/
other_names: メカニカルバディユニバース

title: g-forest_goddess_(ishiyumi)
body:
[tn]"The Goddess of the Forest of G"[/tn]

Tritagonist of "The Goddess of the G-Spring":[/pools/17110], an original Twitter-hosted web series by [[Kato takuji]].

A hardcore fan of [[SD Gundam]]. Among the other goddesses, she's the one with the most common sense.

[[g-spring_goddess|G-Spring Goddess]] is her rival, with whom she often engages in fistfights over Gundam discussions and other topics. She always wins due to type advantage ([[pokemon|Pokemon]] style: grass beats water) and being more powerful in general.

Has no personal attachment to [[gunpla_boy_(ishiyumi)|Gunpla Boy]], but try to convert him as a follower anyway. Either due to her personal crusade of spreading the SD Gundam series, or annoying the G-Spring Goddess, or both.

Just like the characters in her beloved SD Gundam series, she can change between two forms: her petite, flat-chested form (SD: Super Deformed) and her tall, big-breasted form (RF: Real Form). The latter is rarely used, only shown occasionally to annoy the G-Spring Goddess.

title: shu_(mechanical_buddy_universe)
body:
Titular deuteragonist of "Maid Would Want to Protect Her Lady":[/pools/17016], a story set in [[Kato takuji]]'s [[Mechanical Buddy Universe|]]. Serves [[Cordelia herschel (mechanical buddy universe)|Milady]] as her personal attendant and bodyguard.

She is given the name "Shu" in the serialized manga "Mechanical Buddy Universe 1.0", which is Chinese for "mouse".

title: akirara_(ishiyumi)
body: Namesake protagonist of "Mahou Shoujo aKIRARA":[/pools/17108], an original Twitter-hosted web series by [[Kato takuji]].

title: little_lass_(ishiyumi)
body:
小娘
[tn]"Little Girl"[/tn]

Supporting character of "The Goddess of the G-Spring":[/pools/17110], an original Twitter-hosted web series by [[Kato takuji]].

A childhood friend of [[Gunpla Boy (Ishiyumi)|Gunpla Boy]] from the same series. She lives in the same village as him and is concerned when he starts to spend more time in the spring (and by extension, the forest as well).

Later becomes a fan of the mecha series directed by [[Tomino Yoshiyuki]], [spoiler]after a prank gone horribly wrong by the [[G-Spring Goddess (Ishiyumi)|G-Spring Goddess]][/spoilers]. She has never been the same ever since, sporting blank stares and manic smiles, possibly due to the trauma.

Now plays the role of a concerned (cockblocking) 'friend' to prevent the boy from meeting the goddesses as much as possible, either by monopolizing his time or antagonizing them whenever they met (usually both). Her reason is presumed to be out of jealousy and madness.

title: twintailed_girl_(ishiyumi)
body:
Placeholder name.

Titular co-protagonist of "Girls Who Get It":[/pools/17139], an original Twitter-hosted web series by [[Kato takuji]].

Twin-tailed schoolgirl with an interest in mecha and robots. 

Friend to her long-haired counterpart, [[Long-Haired GIRL (ishiyumi)|]].

title: maid_mage_(ishiyumi)
body:
[i]Placeholder name.[/i]

Supporting character in "Isekai Yuusha":[/pools/17175], a [[Yuusha series]]-inspired original Twitter-hosted web series by [[Kato takuji]]. 

A young-looking palace maid/'lady-in-waiting' who also happens to be an apprentice court mage (self declared). Dresses in mage robes and wears a [[witch_hat|mage hat]]. Often carries a wooden [[mage staff]] with a distinctive curl on one end. She has [[freckles]] on her face.

title: dahlia_(mechanical_buddy_universe)
body:
[tn]"Sister/Nun (Banshee Squad Captain)"[/tn]

Protagonist of "The Banshee Cometh":[/pools/17015], a story set in [[Kato takuji]]'s [[Mechanical Buddy Universe|]].

A grizzled veteran and former captain of Banshee Squad, an all-female squad of AugMech pilots. Speaks in a distinctive dialect that is rendered as "Irish English" (a broad mixture of several Hiberno-English dialects) on Danbooru translations.

She is given the name "Dahlia" in the serialized manga "Mechanical Buddy Universe 1.0".
other_names: シスター(泣き女・隊長)

title: tonfa_guy_(mechanical_buddy_universe)
body:
[i]Placeholder name.[/i]

Minor character and antagonist in several stories set in [[Kato takuji]]'s [[Mechanical Buddy Universe|]].

Dual-wields electric [[tonfa]]s and wears a distinctive visored combat helmet that conceals his eyes. Has [[medium_hair|noticeably long]] sidelocks that poke out under his helmet to around chest-level.

title: g-flame_goddess_(ishiyumi)
body:
[tn]"Goddess of the Flame of G"[/tn]

Supporting character of "The Goddess of the G-Spring":[/pools/17110], an original Twitter-hosted web series by [[Kato takuji]].

A fan of [[G Gundam]] and [[Crossbone Gundam]], along with their associated Gundam model kits ([[Gunpla]]).

There's a running gag of her being flamed on social media sites, as a meta pun on her name.

title: long-haired_girl_(ishiyumi)
body:
Placeholder name.

Titular co-protagonist of "Girls Who Get It":[/pools/17139], an original Twitter-hosted web series by [[Kato takuji]].

Long-haired schoolgirl with an interest in mecha and robots. Also has an interest in building Gundam model kits ([[Gunpla]]). She highly resembles [[Suzuya_(kancolle)]] in terms of dress and appearance. Has brown hair though.

Friend to her twintailed counterpart, [[Twintailed GIRL_(ishiyumi)|]].

title: assistant_(mechanical_buddy_universe)
body:
Protagonist of "The Story of a Manga Artist":[/pools/17081], a side story set in [[Kato takuji]]'s [[Mechanical Buddy Universe|]]. Her name is revealed to be "Clara" (nicknamed "the Decimator" when she used to be a mercenary) in the serialized manga "Mechanical Buddy Universe 1.0".

Manga assistant to [[Mangabot_(mechanical_buddy_universe)|]].

title: brave_princess_(ishiyumi)
body:
Co-protagonist of "Isekai Yuusha":[/pools/17175], a [[Yuusha series]]-inspired original Twitter-hosted web series by [[Kato takuji]]. 

A medieval fantasy princess who somehow ended up as the human partner of [[XE-Shine_(ishiyumi)|]].

title: crybaby_(mechanical_buddy_universe)
body:
Primary viewpoint character in the "Records" and "Crybaby" arcs of "The Banshee Cometh":[/pools/17015], a story set in [[Kato takuji]]'s [[Mechanical Buddy Universe|]].

Speaks in a timid tone and is prone to crying. Sometimes has a potty mouth during emotional moments.

Later earns the callsign "Crying Lady" due to her battle achievements. She would eventually become the captain of Banshee Squad, an all-female squad of AugMech pilots.

Past self of [[Dahlia (mechanical Buddy Universe)|]]. Avoid tagging one character with the other (unless they both appear as separate characters), as they both have different appearances and speech patterns.

title: cordelia_herschel_(mechanical_buddy_universe)
body:
Protagonist of "Maid Would Want to Protect Her Lady":[/pools/17016], a story set in [[Kato takuji]]'s [[Mechanical Buddy Universe|]].

Young mistress of an affluent household unravaged by the wars in the Mechanical Buddy Universe. The [[Shu (mechanical buddy universe)|]] is her personal attendant and bodyguard.

She is given the name "Cordelia Herschel" (コーディリア・ハーシェル) in the serialized manga "Mechanical Buddy Universe 1.0".

Is secretly an android taking the place of the 'real' [[Cordelia herschel (young) (mechanical buddy universe)|Milady]], a posthumous character.

title: knight's_&_magic
body:
[i]Knight's & Magic[/i] is a Japanese web and light novel series written by Amazake No Hisago and illustrated by [[Kurogin]]. An anime series ran from July 2 to September 24, 2017. A manga adaptation is currently ongoing, and is illustrated by [[Kato takuji]].

The series features an isekai story where a [[model kit]] enthusiast is reincarnated into a [[fantasy]] world with [[mecha]].

h4. Characters

* [[Ernesti Echevalier]]
* [[Adeltrud Walter]]
* [[Archid Walter]]
* [[Helvi Oberg]]
* [[Stefania Celarti]]

h4. Mecha

* [[Gordoleo]]
* [[Ikaruga (knight's & magic)|]]
* [[Saldotoah]]
* [[Telestale]]
* [[Tzendolg]]

title: blau_(mechanical_buddy_universe)
body:
The titular protagonist of "The Story of a Droid":[/pools/16987], a story set in [[Kato takuji]]'s [[Mechanical Buddy Universe|]].

A masterless android who found an abandoned child and decided to raise him.
To do that, it starts wearing a female 'cyber-skin' and becoming the boy's mother, turning 'it' into a 'she'.

[[Rainy (mechanical buddy universe)|Sondroid]] is her aforementioned adoptive son.

She is given the name "Blau" in the serialized manga "Mechanical Buddy Universe 1.0".

title: hawk_(mechanical_buddy_universe)
body:
Titular deuteragonist of "Hawkeye in Love":[/pools/17005], a story set in [[Kato takuji]]'s [[Mechanical Buddy Universe|]].

An automated sentry gun armed with a sniper machine gun. Holds and reloads the machine gun 'manually' with mechanical arms, unlike most robotic sentry guns with integrated weapons.

It is given the nickname "Hawk" in the serialized manga "Mechanical Buddy Universe 1.0".
other_names: TGP11S自律型狙撃機銃『ホークアイ』

title: mangabot_(mechanical_buddy_universe)
body:
Titular deuteragonist of "The Story of a Manga Artist":[/pools/17081], a side story set in [[Kato takuji]]'s [[Mechanical Buddy Universe|]]. His name is revealed to be "Airget" in the serialized manga "Mechanical Buddy Universe 1.0".

Employer of the [[Assistant_(mechanical_buddy_universe)|]].

title: goggles_guy_(mechanical_buddy_universe)
body:
Minor supporting character of "The Story of a Droid":[/pools/16987], a story set in [[Kato takuji]]'s [[Mechanical Buddy Universe|]]. His name is revealed to be "John" in the serialized manga "Mechanical Buddy Universe 1.0".

Wears a helmet and distinctive combat goggles in most of his appearances. Often appears together with [[Mohawk Guy_(mechanical_buddy_universe)|]].

title: devil's_hand_(ishiyumi)
body:
Titular 'villain' protagonist of "The Devil's Hand at Your Heels":[/pools/17029], an original Twitter-hosted web series by [[Kato takuji]].

She's [spoiler]an insectoid shapeshifter that can take on the form of a human girl. With [[The Thing]]-esque body horror vibes.[/spoiler]

title: ophelia_herschel_(mechanical_buddy_universe)
body:
Little sister of [[cordelia herschel (young) (mechanical buddy universe)|Milady]] from [[Kato takuji]]'s [[Mechanical Buddy Universe]].

She is given the name "Ophelia Herschel" (オフィーリア・ハーシェル) in the serialized manga "Mechanical Buddy Universe 1.0".

Primary antagonist of the "Maid Would Want to Protect Her Lady":[/pools/17016] storyline.

title: jukebox_(mechanical_buddy_universe)
body:
Supporting protagonist of "The Banshee Cometh":[/pools/17015], a story set in [[Kato takuji]]'s [[Mechanical Buddy Universe|]].

Resembles a desktop computer tower unit, with a single eye and a speaker grille in front. Has a collapsible handle allowing it to be hauled around like a suitcase. Plugs into the [[Dahlia (mechanical Buddy Universe)|Banshee Sister]]'s personal command-variant [[Diva_Duo_(Mechanical_Buddy_Universe)|Diva Duo]] as an auxiliary AI core, similar to how certain [[Haro]] units are used in Gundam series set in the Anno Domini timeline.
other_names: 神父(ジュークボックス)
拡戦車のサポートコアユニット

title: cyborg_git_(mechanical_buddy_universe)
body:
[i]Placeholder name.[/i]

Minor antagonist in several stories set in [[Kato takuji]]'s [[Mechanical Buddy Universe|]].

A cyborg with a [[mechanical eye|mechanical left eye]] and a noticeably [[single_mechanical_arm|mechanical left arm]]. Often appears together with [[Punk Git_(mechanical_buddy_universe)|]].

title: kuchisake-onna_(ishiyumi)
body: [[Kato takuji]]'s take on the [[Kuchisake-onna]] creepypasta urban legend. 'Villain' protagonist of Ishiyumi's "Apparition":[/pools/17021] series.

title: rainy_(mechanical_buddy_universe)
body: Deuteragonist of "The Story of a Droid":[/pools/16987], a story set in [[Kato takuji]]'s [[Mechanical Buddy Universe|]]. Adoptive son of [[Blau (mechanical buddy universe)|]]. His name is later revealed to be Rainy, because it was raining when Momdroid first found him as an abandoned infant.

title: riika_rikkinen_(mechanical_buddy_universe)
body:
Protagonist of "Hawkeye in Love":[/pools/17005], a story set in [[Kato takuji]]'s [[Mechanical Buddy Universe|]].

Human paramour of [[hawk (mechanical buddy universe)|Hawkeye]], and granddaughter to the [[Parts Shop Geezer_(mechanical_buddy_universe)|]].

She is given the name "Riika Rikkinen" (リーカ・リッキネン) in the serialized manga "Mechanical Buddy Universe 1.0".

title: ma_no_mono-tachi
body:
A [[fantasy]] setting created by [[Kato takuji]], focusing primarily on groups of [[monster]]s and demons, their interactions with humans, and the hijinks that ensue. The series is comprised of two webcomics:

* "Sir Liebe von Trapp":[/pools/17326]
* "The Devil's Hand at Your Heels":[/pools/17029]

A serialized manga adaptation of the setting illustrated by [[gashi-gashi]] was announced in 2022, titled [[Ma no Mono-tachi wa Kuwadateru]].

h4. See Also
* "Twitter Event":[https://twitter.com/i/events/1495765061297909763] - compilation of posts from both webcomics.

title: akira-kun_(ishiyumi)
body:
Protagonist of "Mahou Shoujo aKIRARA":[/pools/17108], an original Twitter-hosted web series by [[Kato takuji]].

[spoiler]The civilian identity of [[Akirara_(Ishiyumi)|Magical Girl Akirara]].[/spoiler]

title: xe-shine_(ishiyumi)
body:
Titular co-protagonist of "Isekai Yuusha":[/pools/17175], a [[Yuusha series]]-inspired original Twitter-hosted web series by [[Kato takuji]]. 

A humanoid [[super robot]] mecha with a human-looking face, with similar design aesthetics as protagonist super robots from the [[Yuusha series]] (and [[Transformers]], as the Yuusha series were initially based on G1 Takara Transformers designs). Can transform into a car mode.

The "XE" is pronounced as one word, approximately "Gzee" (/ɡziː/). This "XE" is ultimately derived from Japanese "Ten'i" (Displaced); see the artist commentary notes on post #3797310 where the artist explains the derivation of his name.

[spoiler]His actual name is technically just "Shine", with XE-Shine being the name of his powered-up self. XE has been added to the tag to better disambiguate his name.[/spoiler]

Robot partner of [[Brave Princess (Ishiyumi)|]].

title: g-spring_goddess_(ishiyumi)
body:
[tn]"Goddess of the Spring of G", "The Goddess of the Fountain of G" (translation used in the title of one of the author's print books)[/tn]

Namesake protagonist of "The Goddess of the G-Spring":[/pools/17110], an original Twitter-hosted web series by [[Kato takuji]]. She is based on the "Goddess of the Spring" archetype from the Japanese variation of the [[Honest Axe]] fable.

Hardcore fan of various Gundam series and their associated model kits ([[Gunpla]]). Has a preference for submersible Mobile Suits, as befits her element. 

She is also a fan of other mecha series, especially those featuring either [[Tomino Yoshiyuki]] as the director or [[Izubuchi Yutaka]] as the mecha designer.

Has a (violent) rivalry with [[g-forest_goddess_(ishiyumi)|G-Forest Goddess]] where they clash about various Gundam topics and followers, which often ends in a fistfight. She always loses due to type disadvantage ([[pokemon|Pokemon]] style: water loses to grass) and being fairly weak in general.

[[gunpla_boy_(ishiyumi)|Gunpla Boy]] is her one and only follower/pupil, whom she had taken a certain liking to.

title: punk_git_(mechanical_buddy_universe)
body:
[i]Placeholder name.[/i]

Minor antagonist in several stories set in [[Kato takuji]]'s [[Mechanical Buddy Universe|]].

Dresses as a stereotypical punk, with a tall mohawk and a leather vest jacket. Usually armed with a [[revolver]]. Often appears together with [[Cyborg Git_(mechanical_buddy_universe)|]].

title: girphan_(ishiyumi)
body:
Mecha character from "Girls Who Get It":[/pools/17139], an original Twitter-hosted web series by [[Kato takuji]].

Resembles the [[Arx-7 arbalest|ARX-7 Arbalest]] from [[Full Metal Panic!]], but with a different head unit. 

Girphan is often used as a stand-in for the 'protagonist mecha' in imagined scenarios thought up by the GIRLS who get it, or in [[model kit|model kits]] worked on by the same. 

[spoiler]Becomes an actual sentient character later in the story.[/spoiler]

title: hawkeyes_(mechanical_buddy_universe)
body:
Composite character from "Hawkeye in Love":[/pools/17005], a story set in [[Kato takuji]]'s [[Mechanical Buddy Universe|]].

The combined 'superhero' alter-ego of the [[Parts Shop Geezer_(Mechanical_Buddy_Universe)|]]'s [[riika rikkinen (mechanical buddy universe)|granddaughter]] and [[TGP11S Hawkeye_(mechanical_buddy_universe)|]], with the former wearing the latter as a power suit.

Commonly depicted holding a sniper rifle. Wears a hooded cloak with a prominent hawk's beak set in the center-front of the hood, similar to the eagle-beaked hood worn by [[altair_ibn_la-ahad|Altair]] and other Assassin's Creed characters.
other_names: 鷹の双眸『ホークアイズ』

title: parts_shop_geezer_(mechanical_buddy_universe)
body:
Supporting character in [[Kato takuji]]'s [[Mechanical Buddy Universe|]]. Runs a small store/workshop selling weapons and robot/cyborg parts. Grandfather to [[TGP11S Hawkeye (Mechanical_Buddy_Universe)|]]'s paramour. 

His left arm is a cybernetic prosthetic, but this is usually not detailed enough to be seen clearly on most of his appearances in the MBU comics.
other_names: パーツ屋のじいちゃん

body:
Minor supporting character of "The Story of a Droid":[/pools/16987], a story set in [[Kato takuji]]'s [[Mechanical Buddy Universe|]]. His name is revealed to be "Darryl" in the serialized manga "Mechanical Buddy Universe 1.0".

Styles his hair in a distinctive mohawk. Often appears together with [[Goggles Guy_(mechanical_buddy_universe)|]].

title: chuchumy_(ishiyumi)
body:
チュチュミィ、 魚さん
[tn]"Chuchumy", "Mr. Fishy"[/tn]

Supporting character of "The Goddess of the G-Spring":[/pools/17110], an original Twitter-hosted web series by [[Kato takuji]]. 

One of the many talking fish(es) that lives in the G-Spring where the [[G-Spring Goddess (ishiyumi)|]] dwells. Named Chuchumy by the Goddess, after [[Raraiya Monday]]'s [[Chuchumy|pet goldfish]]. Other characters refer to it as "Mr. Fishy".

All the Spring fish(es) are called Chuchumy by the Goddess, so only use this tag when one of the Fishes acts like a 'character' (speaking or visibly reacting counts), and/or when [spoiler]it takes on the form of a humanoid 'fish girl' who shares an uncanny resemblance with Raraiya Monday.[/spoiler].

title: queenie_(mechanical_buddy_universe)
body:
Supporting character of "The Story of a Droid":[/pools/16987], a story set in [[Kato takuji]]'s [[Mechanical Buddy Universe|]].

Speaks in classic onee-kotoba ("Big Sisters' Speech", "camp feminine speech", see "here":[https://www.tofugu.com/japanese/queer-japanese/#word-choice] for a nuanced explanation). Tends to ham up the 'camp' in certain situations, including when dressing up [[Blau (mechanical buddy universe)|]] and [[Son of Droid_(mechanical_buddy_universe)|Son]], or when reacting to comedic situations.

Is given the name "Victoria Venera" in the serialized manga "Mechanical Buddy Universe 1.0"

title: noppera-bou_(ishiyumi)
body:
のっぺらぼう
[tn]"Noppera-onna" ([i]lit.[/i] faceless man)[/tn]

[[Kato takuji]]'s take on the [[noppera-bou]] Japanese youkai. Deuteragonist of Ishiyumi's "Apparition":[/pools/17021] series. A faceless cyborg man capable of imitating other people.

He is given the name "Joey" in the serialized manga "Mechanical Buddy Universe 1.0".

title: elven_founder_(ishiyumi)
body: Main protagonist of "Tales of the Holy Elfroid Hylodom":[/pools/16970], an original Twitter-hosted web series by [[Kato takuji]].

title: gunpla_boy_(ishiyumi)
body:
少年
[tn]"Boy"[/tn]

Deuteragonist of "The Goddess of the G-Spring":[/pools/17110], an original Twitter-hosted web series by [[Kato takuji]]. He is the principal viewpoint character of the series, acting as the audience surrogate.

Originally a casual fan of [[Gunpla]] (introduced to him by the Gundam Build series) before meeting the [[G-Spring Goddess_(ishiyumi)|]]. Gets more and more into both Gundam (the various series) and Gunpla as the story progresses, under her 'tutelage'.

[[g-forest_goddess_(ishiyumi)|G-Forest Goddess]] has tried to convert him into the world of [[SD Gundam]] (and becoming her follower) several times over the course of the series, with varying degrees of success.

[[little_lass_(ishiyumi)|Little Lass]] is his childhood friend from the same village. She's constantly trying to prevent (and later cockblocking) him from meeting the goddesses, for various reasons (first concern, then jealousy, and finally madness).

A fan of [[Gundam Hathaway's Flash]] and its associated Gundam model kits ([[Gunpla]]).

title: lily_everhart
body:
Lily Everhart the Snowfall Sovereign, founder of the Free Pal Alliance and an enemy boss from [[Palworld]].

Lily has [[medium hair|medium length]] [[white hair]] and [[purple eyes]], wears a [[green dress|green]] [[single-shoulder dress]] with a [[black tube top]] and [[detached sleeves|detached]] [[white sleeves]].

She rides her [[Pal (creature)|]] [[Lyleen]] in combat, and carries a [[spear]] on her [[holding polearm behind back|back]].

title: holding_polearm_behind_back
body:
A character is holding any sort of long polearm behind their back, rather than in front of them. The 'polearm' in question can be anything like a [[spear]], [[staff]], [[broom]], rod, or such. This tag basically encompasses the variety of postures that characters can utilize to accomplish this.

Note that this tag refers to when a polearm is actually being [b]held[/b] in the character's hands. If it's strapped to their back, planted in the ground behind them, or they're otherwise not holding it, don't use this tag.

title: kinopio-kun
body:
A [[Green Toad (mario)|]] that is the mascot of [[Nintendo]]'s [[line_(naver)|LINE]] social media account. He would comment on various upcoming Nintendo products. 

His mushroom cap head is green while the spots on them are white, which are inverted colors from the usual Green Toad and resembles that of a [[1-up Mushroom]].

title: purple_toad_(mario)
body:
Purple color variant of the [[Toad (mario)|]]s, becoming standardized in the [[Mario (series)|]] series since [i][[Super Mario Sunshine]][/i]. 

The most common design have purple spots on their heads and wear a [[purple vest]].

h4. See also
* [[Mailtoad]]

title: yellow_toad_(mario)
body:
Yellow color variant of the [[Toad (mario)|]]s, becoming standardized in the [[Mario (series)|]] series since [i][[Super Mario Sunshine]][/i].

The most common design have yellow spots on their heads and wear a [[yellow vest]].

A Yellow Toad also debuts as a playable character in [[New Super Mario Bros. Wii]] as [[Mario]]'s sidekick along with [[Luigi]] and [[Blue Toad (Mario)|Blue Toad]]. This specific Toad is commonly paired with Blue Toad.

h4. See also
* [[Professor Toad (mario)|]]

A Blue Toad also debuts as a playable character in [[New Super Mario Bros. Wii]] as [[Mario]]'s sidekick along with [[Luigi]] and [[Yellow Toad (Mario)|Yellow Toad]]. This specific Toad is commonly paired with Yellow Toad. The Toad that's playable in [[Super Mario 3D World]] is also a Blue Toad.

title: lingering_will_(kingdom_hearts)
body:
Enigmatic entity in [[full armor]] fought as a high difficulty optional boss in [[Kingdom Hearts II|Kingdom Hearts II Final Mix]]. Wields the [[Ends of the Earth]] [[keyblade]]. 

[spoiler]Is the thoughts of [[Terra (Kingdom Hearts)|]] animated into his keyblade armor after his body is stolen by [[Xehanort]] and his heart is sealed away. Considered a separate character from Terra. Not to be confused visually with Terra wearing his keyblade armor; use context or artist's tags/description to differentiate the two.[/spoiler]

title: kikuchi_makoto
body:
One of the main characters of the [[Idolmaster]] series.
Honest, sensitive 16-year-old Makoto's [[reverse trap|boyish]] looks (having been raised as a boy by her father, who wanted one) and skill at sports pigeonholed her into becoming a "pretty-boy idol", much to her chagrin, having originally joined the studio in order to become more feminine.

Makoto's theme color is black, and she is voiced by [[Hirata Hiromi]].

title: sleeveless
body:
A [[shirt]], [[dress]], or other top with a neck but without sleeves, often revealing [[bare arms]].

On Pixiv, the tag "アメリカンスリーブ":http://dic.pixiv.net/a/%E3%82%A2%E3%83%A1%E3%83%AA%E3%82%AB%E3%83%B3%E3%82%B9%E3%83%AA%E3%83%BC%E3%83%96 (American Sleeve) is used to denote a kind of sleeveless clothing where the armholes are cut near the base of the neck to the lower armpit, leaving a large portion of the shoulders bare. This is also typically a [[sleeveless turtleneck]].

This tag may be used for tops with [[detached sleeves]], but not for [[strapless]], [[halterneck]], [[off-shoulder shirt|off-shoulder]], or [[spaghetti strap]] tops. See the differences below.

h4. Examples

* !asset #23066879: Sleeveless
* !asset #23066884: [[Strapless]]
* !asset #23066882: [[Criss-cross halter]]

h4. See also

* [[strapless]]
* [[halterneck]]
* [[low-cut armhole]]
* [[Tag group:sleeves]]

title: receipt
body:
Receipts are [[paper]] documents that are issued to customers after they made the purchase of their items, to acknowledge the transaction for the customer to return and ask refund for any products that they can't use because it's faulty or don't need to use, after they made the transaction.

This tag includes paper warranty, or any documents issued after purchases, used to refunds

title: sylux_(metroid)
body:
A [[Metroid]] character that debuted in [i][[Metroid Prime Hunters]][/i] as a rival and in multiplayer one of the seven playable Bounty Hunters. 

He harbors an extreme hatred for the Galactic Federation and [[Samus Aran]] by proxy, and seems to silently track her movements. His [[power armor|power suit]] and [[starfighter|ship]], the [[Delano 7]], is stolen Federation property.

Visually he is entirely covered with an angular blue suit that is lit with [[neon trim]]s. Attached to his right arm is a [[Arm Mounted Weapon|mounted weapon]] that shoots [[electricity]] called the Shock Coil.

h4. Appearance
* !asset #25620017

Her mother is Usami Yuzuki.

title: bare_legs
body:
When a character's legs are bare, not covered by [[pants]], [[dress]], [[long skirt]], [[thighhighs]], or [[pantyhose]].

Use this tag when the legs are not covered by clothes (including footwear) from the thighs until the middle of the shins.
Images should only have this tag if you can tell from the image that this is the case, meaning that all or almost all of this part of the leg must be in the picture.

Do not use when [[nude]] or [[bottomless]] applies.

body: Ibanez S/SA line of solid body [[electric guitar|electric guitars]]. Shares the general body and headstock shape with more common [[ibanez_rg|Ibanez RG]] with the key difference of having a much thinner, more rounded body shape. body:
The demonic god-queen of [[Makai (Touhou)|Makai]] and the last boss of the fifth [[Touhou (PC-98)|Touhou PC-98]] game, [[Mystic Square]]. She created Makai and everything in it. She is thus considered to be the mother or foster-mother of [[Alice Margatroid (PC-98)|]], the stage 3 boss of Mystic Square and also the Extra stage boss.

She is sometimes depicted as being friends with [[Undefined Fantastic Object]]'s last boss, [[Hijiri Byakuren]], since one of her attacks, "Devil's Recitation", is a spellcard version of Shinki's final bullet pattern from Mystic Square. Since Byakuren was sealed in a portion of Makai, this effectively made Shinki her jailer, granting them an opportunity to interact.

title: himeko_(honkai:_star_rail)
body:
A playable character in [[Honkai: Star Rail]]. Voiced by [[Tanaka Rie]] in Japanese. 

An adventurous scientist who encountered and repaired a stranded train as a child. She now ventures across the universe with her train currently named the [[Astral Express (honkai: star rail)|]], operating as its navigator. 

She has [[yellow eyes]], [[very_long_hair|very long]] [[red hair]], and [[large breasts]] with a [[mole_on_breast|mole on her right breast]]. She typically wears a [[white dress]] that shows off her [[cleavage]], [[black coat]] with the Nameless' badge on the right side, [[black gloves]], and [[black_footwear|black]] [[pumps]]. 

h4. Appearance

* !post #7689866: Splash art
* !post #8768421: Night on the Milky Way (Signature Light Cone)

h4. Profile
[expand]
An adventurous scientist who encountered the Astral Express as a child when it got stranded in her home world.

At that time, some existence in the Express revealed to this young girl a whole world outside of her own — the universe.

Years later, Himeko finally repaired the train and began her journey to the stars, but she realized that this was only the beginning. On the Trailblaze path, she would need many more companions...

Even though such companions may have different destinations in mind, they all gaze at the same starry sky.
[/expand]


h4. See also
* [[Murata Himeko]] - her [[Benghuai Xueyuan]] and [[Honkai Impact 3rd]] counterpart.

title: falklands_war
body:
[b]The Falklands War[/b] ([[spanish_text|Spanish]]: [i]Guerra de Las Malvinas[/i]) was a ten-week undeclared war between [[Argentina]] and the [[United Kingdom]] in 1982 over two British dependent territories in the South Atlantic: the [[Falkland Islands]] and its territorial dependency, South Georgia and the South Sandwich Islands. 

The conflict began on 2 April 1982, when Argentina invaded and occupied the Falkland Islands, followed by the invasion of South Georgia the next day. On 5 April, the British government dispatched a naval task force to engage the Argentine Navy and Air Force before making an amphibious assault on the islands. The conflict lasted 74 days and ended with an Argentine surrender on 14 June, returning the islands to British control. In total, 649 Argentine [[military]] personnel, 255 British military personnel, and three Falkland Islanders were killed during the hostilities.

The conflict was a major [[Cold War]] episode in the protracted dispute over the territories' sovereignty. Argentina asserted (and maintains) that the islands are Argentine territory, and the Argentine government thus described its military action as the reclamation of its own territory. The British government regarded the action as an invasion of a territory that had been a Crown colony since 1841. Falkland Islanders, who have inhabited the islands since the early 19th century, are predominantly descendants of British settlers, and strongly favour British sovereignty and culture.  

The conflict had a strong effect in both countries and has been the subject of various books, articles, films, and songs. Patriotic sentiment ran high in Argentina, but the unfavourable outcome prompted large protests against the ruling military government, hastening its downfall and the democratisation of the country. In the United Kingdom, the Conservative government, bolstered by the successful outcome, was re-elected with an increased majority the following year.  

Diplomatic relations between the United Kingdom and Argentina were restored in 1989 following a meeting in Madrid. The islands continue to operate as a self-governing British Overseas Territory.
other_names: フォークランドふんそう

title: the_fourth_power
body:
A hard [[science fiction]] graphic novel created entirely by notable sci-fi artist [[Juan Gimenez]] and published in 1989.

[b]The Fourth Power[/b] is a story with a female protagonist that is set in the far future. It deals with the concepts of space colonization, political intrigue and "transhumanism":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transhumanism . 

The title of the work refers to the actual definition of the "Fourth Power":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fourth_power used in arithmetic and algebra.

title: soldier_boy_(the_boys)
body:
A fictional superhero character from [[The Boys]].

[b]Soldier Boy[/b] is a [[parody]] of [[Captain America]], but very brutal, sadistic and with severe [[PTSD]].

He has super human strength and resilience and is armed with a [[m1911]], a Bowie [[knife]] and a very heavy Titanium [[shield]]. Also wears a military green [[superhero costume]] with a mask. 

In the TV show Soldier Boy has the ability to produce a very destructive high [[radiation]] energy blast [spoilers]that can remove compound V from any superpowered individual's body, turning them into regular people. He also is a [[World War II]] combat veteran and apparently never ages (or ages slower than regular humans). Currently in deep hybernation at a secret laboratory.[/spoilers].

title: captain_america
body:
[i]An Avenger! And an icon to people everywhere; [b]Captain America[/b] is the definition of a true hero![/i]
---[b]Stan Lee[/b]

A [[Marvel]] superhero created by legendary comic book artists Joe Simon and [[Jack Kirby]].

[b]Captain America[/b], real name [[Steve Rogers]], used to be a skinny, short soldier who was given a serum during [[World War II]] that bestowed him with super human physical abilities above the peak of human potential. He is easily identified by his red-white-and-blue [[superhero costume]] and similarly designed circular shield which is made of Vibranium, a fictional metal that is rare and can reflect any and all attacks.

He is one of the most recognized members of [[Avengers (series)|The Avengers]].

h4. See also
* [[Soldier Boy (The Boys)]]
other_names: キャプテン・アメリカ

title: waverider_crash
body:
[[Zeta Gundam (mobile suit)|Zeta Gundam]]'s trademark finishing move, first seen used in the final episode of its [[Zeta Gundam|eponymous show]] and commonly featured as the unit's strongest attack in [[Super Robot Wars]]. 

In [[wave rider|Waverider]] Mode, the Zeta Gundam does a high-speed ramming maneuver onto its target, which is rendered unable to move by the former's Biosensor System. The Biosensor also uses the spirits of the deceased (usually those of who have a relationship with the pilot such as friends or even enemies) to boost the power of this attack. 

[spoilers]Zeta's pilot [[Kamille Bidan]] uses this move to kill [[Paptimus Scirocco]], who was prior to this, untouchable in combat thanks to his Newtype powers, piloting skill and the speed and tough armor of his [[The O (mobile Suit)|]] [[mobile suit]]. Despite decisively winning using this move, it became Kamille's undoing due to Scirocco being able to hit him with a mind-crippling psychic attack at close proximity with his dying breath, that turned him [[ptsd|insane]] afterwards (and becoming a [[vegetative_state|vegetable]] at the start of [[Gundam ZZ]]).[/spoilers]

This tag is also used for the exaggerated facial expression Scirocco makes during the scene.
other_names: ウェイブライダー突撃

title: kamille_bidan
body:
A fictional character from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse.

Main protagonist of [[zeta_gundam|Mobile Suit Zeta Gundam]] and a supporting character in [[gundam_zz|Mobile Suit Gundam ZZ]]. He is the dark [[blue hair]]ed pilot of the [[Gundam Mk II|RX-178 Gundam Mk-II]] and designer and pilot of the [[Zeta Gundam (mobile suit)|MSZ-006 Zeta Gundam]].

[b]Kamille Bidan[/b] has a huge complex regarding his name, which is why he takes up [[Mobile Suit]] engineering and [[karate]].

He gets into a fistfight with a [[Jerid Messa|Titans operative]] who makes a small jibe about his name, and things only go worse from there...

[spoiler]
In 2005~2006 film [b]Mobile Suit Zeta Gundam: A New Translation[/b], his fate (and personality) was drastically changed. A latent but powerful Newtype, after witnessing (and suffering) the [[titans_(gundam)|Titans]]' brutality firsthand Kamille becomes a mecha pilot and MS designer for the [[AEUG]].[/spoiler] 

[spoiler]At the end of the original Zeta Gundam series he is left with [[ptsd|severe mental disease]] and [[crazy|psychosis]] due to his duel with Titans officer and MS ace [[Paptimus Scirocco]], who attacked Kamille with a powerful [[newtype_flash|Newtype mental blast]] as he died, [[waverider_crash|crushed]] by Kamille's [[zeta_gundam_(mobile_suit)|Zeta Gundam MS]] during the final battle of The Gryps War.[/spoiler] 

[spoiler]Fortunately Kamille's [[vegetative state]] is reverted and his mind is eventually healed (thanks to [[Fa Yuiry]]'s constant care) at the end of [[Gundam ZZ]]. Years later he appears during the events of [[gundam_uc_0099:_moon_crisis|Moon Crisis]], now as a medical [[doctor]], having left the military for good and becoming a dedicated medicine student.[/spoiler]

Voiced by [[Tobita Nobuo]].

h4. Kamille's Women
* [[Fa Yuiry]]
* [[Four Murasame]]
* [[Rosamia Badam]]
* [[Emma Sheen]]

title: tem_ray
body:
A character from the [[Gundam]] series. He first appeared in the [[Mobile Suit Gundam]] TV series from 1979. Also plays an important part in [[Mobile Suit Gundam The Origin]].

[b]Tem Ray[/b] is a very intelligent [[Earth Federation]] [[scientist]] and [[engineer]] who helped to create the [[RX-78-2 Gundam]] [[mobile suit]]. He is the father of [[Amuro Ray]] and the husband of [[Kamaria Ray]].

[spoilers]During the [[Zeon]] attack on the colony where the first Gundam was being tested he is sucked out into space after an explosion breaches the hull of the facility. Fortunately he survives as Tem was wearing a [[spacesuit]]. However, due to a prolonged exposure to hypoxia as he was rescued after his suit's oxygen reserves were almost depleted, Tem's brain is damaged permanently beyond recovery and develops symptoms of dementia.[/spoilers] 

[spoilers]Later in the series his son [[Amuro Ray]] visits him and becomes shocked by Tem's mental condition. Sometime afterwards a [[crazy]] and disturbed Tem is last seen falling from the stairs of his apartment and his final fate is left uncertain.[/spoilers]

h4. See also
* [[Tem Ray's Circuit]]

title: ben_wooder
body:
A fictional antagonist character from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. He appeared in [[Zeta Gundam]] (1985).

[b]Ben Wooder[/b] is a serious and cruel [[titans_(gundam)|Titans]] ground forces military officer.

His big, [[manly]] and muscular character design looks somewhat similar to [[He-Man]].

title: shouyudai
body: Literally translates to "soy sauce fish". This is the generic Japanese name for those tiny fish-shaped [[soy sauce]] [[bottle]]s that are often packed into Asian cuisine takeaway meals (although they're starting to become less common nowadays due to plastic waste concerns). They were originally invented by the Japanese company "Asahi Sougyou":[http://www.asahi-so.co.jp/lunch/], which still makes and sells them under the "LunCharm" brand name.

title: yamato_nadeshiko_(hyakkano)
body:
Character from [[Kimi no Koto ga Dai Dai Dai Dai Daisuki na 100-nin no Kanojo]]. [[Aijou Rentarou]]'s thirteenth girlfriend, moving in from America to teach Japanese (not English as you'd expect). Usually called "Naddy" by her students.

[spoiler]She is actually a full-blooded Japanese woman, and barely speaks any English. She really likes America's concept of freedom.[/spoiler]

title: gundam
body:
A very popular and long lasting [[mecha]] media franchise created by [[Tomino Yoshiyuki]] and [[Sunrise (company)|]] in 1979.

Because of its popularity and longevity, the [b]GUNDAM[/b] franchise is often considered the Japanese [[Star Wars]] (and [[Star Trek]]).

For the first Gundam show by Tomino, see [[Mobile Suit Gundam]]. 

h4. See also

* [[Mobile Suit]]
* [[Mobile Armor]]

* [[Newtype Flash]]

* [[List of Gundam titles]]

* [[List of Gundam mechas]]

h4. External links 

* "Wikipedia: Gundam":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gundam
other_names: ウマ娘ガンダムダービー

title: gundam_gihren_no_yabou
body:
[b]Mobile Suit Gundam: Gihren’s Greed[/b] ([i][b]Kidou Senshi Gundam Gihren no Yabou[/b][/i]) is a series of turn-based strategy [[video game]]s developed and published by [[Bandai]], based on the popular [[Gundam]] franchise. 

It takes its gameplay style from the [[SD Gundam series]] and adds political and military management to [[mobile_suit_gundam|"The One Year War"]]. The first game in the series, "Gihren's Greed", was released in 1998 for the [[Sega Saturn]] game console.

The title is derived from that of [[Nobunaga's Ambition]], although the English title uses a different translation for the word [i]yabou[/i].
other_names: 機動戦士ガンダムギレンの野望

title: touhou_lensed_night_sky_kaseigai
body:
Touhou Lensed Night Sky, Kaseigai is a nontraditional bullet hell that focuses on a fully modular loadout. The player's own attacks and special effects can be exchanged midway through runs as the situation demands, or simply for fun.

There are a lot of ways to approach the game, with three playable characters, four major difficulty options, and a myriad of challenges and difficulty-lowering options that can be enabled or disabled at will.

title: renamon
body:
Beast Man-type Child-level [[Digimon]] that debuted in [[Digimon Tamers]] in 2001. In the series, Renamon features as [[Makino Ruki]]'s partner Digimon and is therefore one of the show's main characters.

Renamon appears as a [[furry female|furry]] [[fox girl]] with [[yellow fur|yellow]]/[[orange fur|orange]] and [[white fur|white]] [[body fur]] wth a [[neck fur|neck tuft]], [[black sclera]] with [[blue eyes]], a [[facial mark]] beneath one eye, and a [[leg tattoo]].

[u]Common evolutionary throughline:[/u]
[[Relemon]] -> [[Pokomon (digimon)|]] -> [b]Renamon[/b] -> [[Kyuubimon]] -> [[Taomon]] -> [[Sakuyamon]].
* Renamon can further evolve upon exposure to the [[Renamon X-Antibody|X-Antibody]].

title: police_zaku
body:
A fictional manned giant robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse.
 
[b]MS-06-SSP Police Zaku[/b]

A variant of the [[Zaku]] [[Mobile Suit]] that appears in [[Gundam Gquuuuuux]].

Following the events of [[mobile_suit_gundam|The One Year War]]; [[Zeon]] sold off some of their older Zaku units as many were a war excedent following the adoption of new and better MS derived from tecnology obtained from the capture of the [[White Gundam]].

The [[space habitat|colonies]] consisting of the independent Side 6 would modify the Zakus they obtained into a special mobile suit police force in fear of a future [[Zeon]] (or any other) attack.

The police Zaku appears similar to the regular Zaku but with some minor alterations. The most notable of these alterations are its [[blue armor|blue color scheme]] and shoulder-mounted police lights.

title: beni-enma
body:
Saber-class Servant seen in [[Fate/Grand Order]]. She is the sparrow from the Japanese fable [i]Shita-kiri Suzume[/i] ("Tongue-Cut Sparrow"). Her Noble Phantasm is "Jyuu-Ou Hanketsu - Tsuzura no Michiyuki".

When not in battle, she is the proprietress of the Enma Pavilion, and runs a culinary course for Heroic Spirits -- her strict nature and acerbic tongue towards her students has given her the fan nickname "loli birb [[Gordon Ramsay]]".

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Harada Takehito]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Kuno Misaki]]

title: sakuyamon
body:
Ultimate-level God Man-type [[Digimon (creature)|Digimon]] that debuted in [[Digimon Tamers]] in 2001. Sakuyamon is often demonstrated as the Ultimate form of [[Renamon]]. Sakuyamon has the appearance of a [[miko]], but [[nontraditional miko|with an unusual choice of attire]], including [[gold armor]] consisting of a [[mask]] and [[breastplate]] over a [[black bodysuit|black]] [[bodysuit]]. It typically has [[medium breasts|medium]] to [[large breasts]] ranging between depictions and wields a [[shakujou]]. Sakuyamon is also accompanied by four kuda-gitsune shikigami at all times.

In Digimon Tamers, Sakuyamon is the Ultimate Evolution of [[Makino Ruki]]'s partner Renamon, achieved when Ruki and Renamon Matrix Evolve together.

[u]Common evolutionary throughline:[/u]
[[Relemon]] -> [[Pokomon (Digimon)|]] -> [[Renamon]] -> [[Kyuubimon]] -> [[Taomon]] -> [b]Sakuyamon[/b].
* Sakuyamon has a Mode Change called [[Sakuyamon: Miko Mode|Miko Mode]].
* Sakuyamon evolves further upon exposure to the [[Sakuyamon X-Antibody|X-Antibody]].
* Sakuyamon has a purple-colored counterpart named [[Kuzuhamon]], which is of a lower standing as Sakuyamon itself.

title: quetzalcoatl_(fate)
body:
Rider-class Servant in [[Fate/Grand Order]] first appearing in the [[Babylonia (fate/grand order)|]] singularity. A god from [[Aztec]] mythology who loves humans and grants them his blessings.

Quetzalcoatl is depicted as female [spoiler](due to the Aztec gods in Fate universe actually being alien parasites who take on human hosts)[/spoiler], and she loathes her fellow god [[Tezcatlipoca (fate)|]] due to their differing beliefs on human sacrifice. Loves [[luchador]] and inserts gratuitous English in her sentences (localized to Spanish in the English translation).

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Hiroe Rei]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Endou Aya]]

title: to_be_continued
body:
Phrase included when a written or drawn work is incomplete and will be continued in the next illustration or comic. Also included at the end of a TV episode when a story had to be cut short due to time constraints, usually at a cliffhanger situation.

Gained [[meme|memetic fame]] when [[Jojo no Kimyou na Bouken]] used the text within an arrow (together with giving the final frame [[sepia]] tones) to end most episodes (typically on a cliffhanger) of the anime adaptations with, together with "the opening riff":https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cPCLFtxpadE&t=40s of the song "[[Roundabout (song)|]]" by [[Yes (band)|]] as the first season's ending.

A similar memetic format is used in [i][[The Eric Andre Show]][/i] at the end of its segments where the scene freezes abruptly with the text "We'll Be Right Back", alongside the song "Oregon Spirit" by Rolf Kruger.

h4. Examples

* !asset #23040127: The Famous JJBA "To be continued"

h4. See Also

* pool #7229 - Cliffhanger

title: bradamante_(fate)
body:
Lancer-class Servant in [[Fate/Grand Order]], first appearing in the [[Holy Samba Night|2018 Christmas event]]. She is the main heroine of the two Italian epic poems [i]Orlando Innamorato[/i] and [i]Orlando Furioso[/i].

The animation for her Noble Phantasm became famous among the playerbase (to wit, all her ass-related fanart on Pixiv "has its own tag":[https://www.pixiv.net/tags/プリケツダマンテ/artworks]) for featuring a close-up shot of her [[ass]].

title: kashimashi
body:
A [[yuri]] manga drawn by [[Katsura Yukimaru]] with story by Akahori Satoru (赤堀悟). The story focuses on [[Osaragi Hazumu]], a normal, albeit effeminate high school boy who is killed when an [[ufo|alien spaceship]] crash lands on him, only to be restored to health [[genderswap (mtf)|as a girl]]. This results in a same-sex [[love triangle]] that Hazumu finds herself in with two of her best female friends.
An anime adaption aired in 2006.

title: edel_note
body:
A unit from [[Link! Like! Love Live!]], originally under Mizukawa Girls' High School before it closed down. It is the unit Hasu no Sora tied with in the Love Live! Finals in the 104th year, necessitating a play-off round. Its members transferred to Hasu no Sora Girls' High School in its 105th year, and the unit will disband come the following year.

Its members are [[Ceras Yanagida Lilienfeld]] and [[Katsuragi Izumi]].

title: trevor_c._belmont
body:
Playable character in [[Castlevania III: Dracula's Curse]], [[Castlevania: Curse of Darkness|Curse of Darkness]], and [[Castlevania Pachislot|Pachislot]].

Known as [b]Ralph C. Belmondo[/b] in Japan. In the Japanese dub of the [[Castlevania (Netflix)|Netflix series]], he keeps his western name.
other_names: ラルフ・C・ベルモンド
トレバー・ベルモンド

title: alucard_(castlevania)
body:
Full name: Adrian Fahrenheit Țepeș (also Adrian Farenheights Tepes).

The son of [[Dracula (castlevania)|Count Dracula]] and a human woman named [[Lisa Tepes|Lisa]]. A recurring protagonist of the [[Castlevania (series)|]] series of video games, he first appeared as a guest character in [[Castlevania III: Dracula's Curse]] and became the main playable character in [[Castlevania: Symphony of the Night]], which marked the first time a non-Belmont and non-whip user took center stage.

His 21st century alias is [[Arikado Genya]].

h4. External links

* "pixiv Encyclopedia Entry (Japanese)":[https://dic.pixiv.net/a/%E3%82%A2%E3%83%AB%E3%82%AB%E3%83%BC%E3%83%89]
other_names: アドリアン・ファーレンハイツ・ツェペシュ
アドリアン・ツェペシュ
アルカード(悪魔城ドラキュラ)

title: dracula_(castlevania)
body:
A prominent antagonist in the [[Castlevania (series)|]] video game series, there known as Vlad Țepeș Dracula. In this series, his appearance has shifted between entries, though he usually retains a gentlemanly air. However, his demonic transformations run a wide gauntlet. His son is Adrian Fahrenheit Țepeș (who is most often seen going by the name "[[Alucard (Castlevania)|]]", Dracula backwards, in defiance of his evil father), and his main confidant and right-hand is [[Death (Castlevania)|]] (the Grim Reaper).

h4. See Also

* [[Dracula]]
other_names: ドラキュラ(悪魔城ドラキュラ)

title: mannosuke
body:
The Western [[Touhou]] fandom's nickname for the fan-made alter-ego of [[Morichika Rinnosuke]]. Popularly depicted as [[muscular|muscular]] and parading around in an immodest [[fundoshi]]. Sometimes applied simply when Rinnosuke is looking or being [[manly]] in general. Compare [[Cho Marisa]].

The Japanese name of this character is こーりん (Koorin), which is also used as a nickname of "normal" [[Morichika Rinnosuke]].

h4. External links

title: castlevania:_symphony_of_the_night
body:
A [[Castlevania (series)|]] game released for the [[PlayStation 1]] (and Japan-only [[Sega Saturn]]) by [[Konami]] on March 20, 1997. It is a direct sequel of [[Castlevania: Rondo of Blood]].

It is notable for its [[Metroid]]-like gameplay, earning the term [i]Metroidvania[/i].

title: nexas_(vtuber)
body:
A defunct [[virtual YouTuber|VTuber]] agency whose talents all streamed on the streaming app [[AniLive]] that aimed to be an "academia" for talents aspiring to be the next generation of virtual stars. Later, most talents would start streaming on YouTube and/or Twitch, either stopping activities on AniLive completely, do streams on both AniLive and their platform that they stream on or do a mix of both AniLive and YouTube or Twitch (depending on what platform the talent debuted on) streams in a week based on their schedule. The company was founded by forCreators CEO Harry So, who is depicted as an [[owl]].

NEXAS completed angel funding in December 2023, launched in February 2024 and began operations in April of the same year. On December 9, 2024, NEXAS announced that it would cease operations as a talent agency on January 31, 2025, with talents getting the opportunity to keep their models and become [[indie virtual youtuber|independent]], instead becoming a hub to connect content creators with opportunities. On the day of its closure, it announced that "Phase 1" (the VTuber agency phase) had been completed, but they said that it wasn't over for them and that "Phase 2" would start later in 2025.

At the time of closure, it managed 61 members (24 in Class Genesis, 13 in Class Nebulink, 8 in Class Yume and 16 in Class Tensei). There were also 6 other members that have either graduated or gotten fired.

Not to be confused with the [[nexas|artist of the same name]].

title: elegg_(nikke)
body:
A playable character from [[Goddess of Victory: Nikke]]. A member of the [[Electric Shock (nikke)|]] squad with [[Trony (nikke)|]].

She specializes in electronics. Her goal is to [[it_runs_doom_(meme)|install her favorite FPS video game BOOM on every device with a screen]].

Her characterization is a homage to the [[Doom (series)|]] franchise. Her [[boomstick (nikke)|weapon]] is based on the [[BFG 9000]] from the 2005 movie, [[Doom (2005 movie)|]]. The cover art for the character from BOOM is a homage to the cover art of [[Doom (2016)]]. Elegg's obsession of installing BOOM to every device is a reference to how people can play the original 1993 Doom on certain devices such as a [[calculator]].

She has a [[short hair|short]] [[two-tone hair|two-toned]] [[blonde hair]] which [[hair over eyes|covers]] her [[purple eyes]] along with [[huge breasts]] and [[plump]] body. Her outfit consists of a [[crop top]] with [[black sports bra]], [[suspenders]], [[thigh strap]], and a [[short shorts]] with a [[bag]] on her left side.

Illustrator: [[jam (nandade)|]]

h4. Official art

* !post #7236836: Default

title: jeanne_d'arc_alter_(fate)
body:
Umbrella tag for the dark version of Jeanne d'Arc from [[Fate/Grand Order]]. Also called [b]Jalter[/b] for short by fans.

Unlike the other [[alter servant]]s, Jeanne Alter is a separate entity of the original Jeanne d'Arc. She was created by [[Gilles de Rais (caster) (fate)|Gilles de Rais]], who was so obsessed with Jeanne that he used a corrupted [[Holy Grail_(fate)|]] to "revive" her. As a result, she is a polar opposite of Jeanne, as she wished to destroy France rather than protect it, as she blamed the very existence of France as a cause of her "original" death.

She is often depicted as being [[tsundere]] in official and fan works, and being somewhat annoyed (though secretly admiring) that the original Jeanne treats her as a sister.

For her original Ruler variant, see [[Jeanne d'Arc (Fate)]].

For her Santa variant, see [[Jeanne d'Arc Alter Santa Lily (Fate)]].

title: danganronpa_v3:_killing_harmony

[i][b]New Danganronpa V3: Everyone's New Semester of Killing[/b][/i] is the third main title in the [[Danganronpa (series)|]] visual novel series, developed by Spike Chunsoft. Separate from the Hope's Peak saga, the story instead follows a group of students recognised by the government's "Ultimates" sponsorship program held prisoner in [[Monokuma]]'s Gifted Inmates Academy. title: hong_meiling
body:
Stage 3 mid-boss and boss of [[Touhou]]'s [[Embodiment of Scarlet Devil]], and later a recurring playable character.

A humanoid youkai (presumably resembling a Han Chinese). She works as the gatekeeper of the [[Scarlet Devil Mansion]] and specializes in Chinese martial arts. Unusually for a Touhou character, it is unclear what kind of youkai Meiling is, but many fans associate her with [[dragon]]s. This is in part due to the star on her [[beret]], which bears the Chinese character for "[[dragon]]" (龍, [i]Long[/i]). Hong is also the name of a specific dragon from Chinese mythology, implying Meiling has some relation (such as parent and child), or actually is Hong, leading to frequent depictions [[Hong Meiling (dragon)|as a dragon]]. There are also occasional images that depict her [[Hong Meiling (panda)|as a panda]].

Fandom also often depicts Meiling as being lazy and ineffective at her job, and often being berated and/or [[knifed|punished]] for this by [[Izayoi Sakuya]]. In canon, however, her relationship with Sakuya is actually something closer to amicable co-workers, if not outright friendship, and she is generally very good at her job of repelling intruders, with the notable exception of [[Kirisame Marisa]], who everyone else at the mansion admits is impossible to keep out when she wants access to [[Voile]].

Sometimes known by her nickname "China" (中国, [i]Chuugoku[/i]), which originated on [[2channel]] during a debate about the proper reading of her name's kanji (some believed it to be the Japanese reading "Kurenai Misuzu", and it wasn't until later that [[ZUN]] revealed that the Chinese reading "Hong Meiling" is correct). Fans came to an agreement that her defining characteristic is being Chinese, and thus called her "China".

h4. Example

* !post #4703408: Usual Appearance

h4. See also 

* [[Hong Meiling (dragon)]]
* [[Hong Meiling (panda)]]
* [[Hei Meiling]] 
* [[Lie Meiling]] 
* [[knifed]]

h4. External links

* "Touhou Wiki: Hong Meiling":http://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Hong_Meiling

title: mr._match_(mega_man)
body:
A character from the [[Mega Man Battle Network (series)|]] series. First appears as a member of the WWW crime syndicate under [[Dr. Wily (mega man)|]]'s command, but later becomes a neutral character.

He operates the [[NetNavi]]s [[FireMan.EXE]] in the first and fourth game, [[HeatMan.EXE]] in the second and sixth games, and [[FlameMan.EXE]] in the third game.

title: gomen_yuuka
body:
A [[Blue Archive]] meme about [[Yuuka (Blue Archive)|]] being [[reverse netorare|cuckolded]] by someone else (usually [[Noa (Blue Archive)|]]) by stealing [[Sensei (Blue Archive)|]], who she has a crush on.

The meme is often accompanied by Noa's catchphase "I'm sorry Yuuka" (ごめユウカ - gomen yuuka), though this is used in a more passive aggressive manner.

Spin-offs of this meme include Gomen Noa (a [[role reversal|]]), Gomen Hina (Sensei being stolen away from [[Hina (Blue Archive)|]],  usually by [[Iroha (Blue Archive)|]]), or Gomen Fuuka ([[Fuuka (Blue Archive)|]] suffering at the hands of the Gourmet Research Society).

h4. See also
* [[Gomen Yui]]

title: iskandar_(fate)
body:
[[Fate/Zero]] character. The Rider-class servant of [[Waver Velvet]]. He also appears in [[Fate/Grand Order]]. His true name is Iskandar, aka [[Alexander the Great]].

A hulking, [[muscular male|muscular]] [[beard|bearded]] man with [[red hair]], [[red eyes]], wearing [[leather]] armor, including a [[breastplate]] with a [[front slit]] and a [[fur-trimmed_cape|fur-trimmed]] [[red cape]]. When wearing casual clothes, he's usually shown with a short sleeved [[T-shirt]] and [[jeans]].

He has been paired by fans with [[Napoleon Bonaparte (fate)|]] from the same game, due to the Napoleon's admiration of him as well as their real life historical connections. They have been drawn together by Napoleon's official designer [[Ryota-H]] [s](post #3531202)[/s].

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Takeuchi Takashi]]

title: angra_mainyu_(fate)
body:
A servant first appeared in [[Fate/hollow ataraxia]], being the first Avenger-class servant of the franchise.

While his true form is that of a pitch-black humanoid [[silhouette]], he is usually depicted with the body of [[Emiya Shirou]]. In this form, he has his hands and feet wrapped with [[bandages]], [[yellow eyes]], short [[black hair]], a [[red headband]], and [[full-body tattoo]]s.

Major antagonist in the [[fate (series)|Fate series]]. He participated in the Third Holy Grail War but was defeated. The [[holy grail (fate)|]] became corrupted as a result, turning it into the equivalent of All the World's Evils.

He appears as the irregular Servant Avenger in [[Fate/hollow ataraxia]], replacing [[Cu Chulainn (fate/stay night)|]] as [[Bazett Fraga McRemitz]]'s Servant.

In the [[Heaven's Feel]] route of [[Fate/Stay Night]], he becomes [[Matou Sakura]]'s Servant.

Also appears in [[Fate/Grand Order]] in the Friend Point banner, being a unique 0-Star Avenger.

[b]True Name:[/b] Angra Mainyu, the evil god of Zoroastrian religion
[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Takeuchi Takashi]] ([[Fate/hollow ataraxia]]), [[Nekotawawa]] ([[Fate/Grand Order]])
[b]Voice Actor:[/b] [[Terashima Takuma]]

title: pokemon_adventures
body:
[b]Pokemon Adventures[/b] (Japanese: [i]Pocket Monsters SPECIAL[/i], also known as [i]Pokémon Special[/i]) is a long-running manga series based on the [[pokemon|Pokémon]] games.

The series is written by Hidenori Kusaka and illustrated by [[Mato (mato-san_no_hon)|]] for the first 9 volumes. When Mato became ill and was unable to continue illustrating the series, [[Yamamoto Satoshi]] took over as the illustrator and still continues as the series' artist.

h4. Main characters

* Generation I: [[Red (pokemon)|]], [[Blue Oak]], [[Green (pokemon)|]], [[Yellow (pokemon)|]]
* Generation II:  [[Ethan (pokemon)|Gold]], [[Silver_(pokemon)|]], [[Kris (pokemon)|Crystal]]
* Generation III:  [[Brendan (pokemon)|Ruby]], [[may (pokemon)|Sapphire]], [[Emerald_(pokemon)|]]
* Generation IV:  [[Lucas (pokemon)|Diamond]], [[Barry (pokemon)|Pearl]], [[dawn (pokemon)|Platinum]] ("Ojousama")
* Generation V: [[Hilbert (pokemon)|Black]], [[Hilda (pokemon)|White]], [[Nate (pokemon)|Blake]], [[Rosa (pokemon)|Whitley]]
* Generation VI: [[Calem (pokemon)|X]], [[Serena (pokemon)|Yvonne]] (Y)
* Generation VII: [[Elio (pokemon)|Sun]], [[Selene (pokemon)|Moon]]
* Generation VIII: [[Victor (pokemon)|Henry Sword]], [[Gloria (pokemon)|Casey Shield]]
* Generation IX: [[Florian (pokemon)|Violet Lang]], [[Juliana (pokemon)|Scarlet Koito]]


h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Pokemon Adventures":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pokémon_Adventures

title: thomas_edison_(fate)
body:
A Caster-class Servant in [[Fate/Grand Order]] first appearing in the [[E Pluribus Unum (fate/grand order)|]] singularity. A depiction of the (in)famous inventor and businessman of the same name. Has a rivalry with [[Nikola Tesla (fate)|]].

He's tall and [[muscular]], has a white [[lion]] [[animal head|head]], and wears a [[blue bodysuit]] and [[red gloves]]. In his later ascensions, he gains [[light bulb]]s on both shoulders and rainbow wings.

[spoilers]His appearance is a result of an attempt by the government of the [[United States]] to create a servant that is "the manifestation of the American Dream" to protect the country by merging his heroic spirit with various heroic spirits of United States presidents and the concept of [i]American Dream[/i]. Essentially turned Edison into a physical manifestation of the United States.[/spoilers]

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Pako (pakosun)|]]
[b]Voice Actor:[/b] [[Terashima Takuma]]

Not to be confused with [[Boggart (fate)|]], who is likewise a white lion humanoid from the [[Avalon le Fae (fate/grand order)|Britain Lostbelt]].

title: realified
body:
A type of character design based on applying "real life logic" where a [[Pokemon_(creature)|pokemon]], [[Pal_(creature)|Pal]], [[Digimon_(creature)|digimon]], etc is drawn as the thing or creature they were based on. Distinct from simply being drawn well or [[realism]] in that it is about applying "real world logic" to the design. Though the distinction can be blurry espcially when dealing with designs that already closely resemble what they are based on, eg, pokemon that very closely look like a real life animal with little change. A good indicator of this can be a character design being changed to be more like the real life counterpart, such as a bipedal character based on a quadrupedal creature being drawn walking on all fours like the real life creature. As opposed to just adding more detail, eg visible strands of fur on something that was already furry but not that detailed.

h6. Examples
* !post #6246371
* !post #624590
* !post #8387525
* !post #8070015

h6. Realified vs just detailed/well drawn
* !post #682593: Realified. Proportions of a real turtle.
* !post #7529050: Detailed but not made to look like an actual turtle.

title: danganronpa_3_(anime)
body:
[b]Danganronpa 3: The End of Hope's Peak Academy[/b] (ダンガンロンパ３ –The End of 希望ヶ峰学園–) is a TV anime series that aired for 25 episodes starting on July 2016, which is being directed by Seiji Kishi at Lerche. It is advertised as the final chapter of the Hope's Peak Saga of the first two games in [[Danganronpa (series)|]].

The anime was split into two Arcs; [i]Side: Future[/i], which told the story of the Future Foundation members being forced into one last Killing Game, and and [i]Side: Despair[/i], which shows how the 77th class of Hope's Peak fell into despair. Both series wrapped up with a finale episode, titled [i]Side: Hope[/i].

Not to be confused with [[Danganronpa V3: Killing Harmony]].

Characters appearing in the [i]Side: Despair[/i] Arc generally wear the [[Hope's Peak Academy School Uniform]].

title: togami_byakuya_(danganronpa_2)
body:
A version of [[Togami Byakuya]] that appears in [i][[Danganronpa 2: Goodbye Despair]][/i]. In contrast to his appearance in the first game, he is [[obese]] and wears a white [[suit]].

[spoiler]In reality, his true identity is the [[Ultimate Imposter]], and he has no real name. His true appearance is revealed in Chapter 5 and in the anime [i][[Danganronpa 3 (anime)|]][/i], which simply narrows his eyes and gives him long [[black hair]] that has been [[hair slicked back|slicked back]]. He fills in for [[Mitarai Ryota]] in Hope's Peak while he is busy finishing his anime project.[/spoiler]

title: halo_framing
body:
The symbolic framing of an image/scene to make a character appear as if they have a halo without an actual halo being present. Often done through having a light source behind the head. Almost always the subject in question would be unaware that this is happening.

h4. Examples
* !post #8821712
* !post #7430091
* !post #7622077

H4. Things that don't count
* Actual halos
* Fake halos, mechanical halos, and painted halos
* Sun/moons or other light sources behind the subjects head but not framed as in a way to resemble a halo post #8952034

H4. Related
* [[Symbolism]]
* [[Sun behind head]] / [[moon behind head]]
* [[Backlighting]]
* [[Halo]]
** [[Traditional halo]]
** [[Halo behind head]]

title: enri_louvre
body:
The mute protagonist of [[Naraku]]. Shy and unable to approach people to make friends, she's dragged by the school bully [[Emma White]] to the purgatory building on a scare dare. She winds up trapped and becomes a demonic entity.

In [[Naraku 2]], she has mastered her new powers and has become more confident as a result. She's also more talkative- in a sense, as she is willing to communicate with [[Ebel Alfie|]] through facial expressions and emotions.

title: virginia_aran
body:
The [[mother]] of [[Samus Aran]] and wife of [[Rodney Aran]], who died during the [[Space Pirate (metroid)|]] raid of planet K-2L. 

In one of the ending images of [[Metroid Fusion]] she is shown protecting a young Samus while [[Ridley]] approaches charging his plasma breath, while in the [[Metroid]] manga she is able to just in time distract Ridley who was about to kill a young Samus,  allowing Samus to escape while instead herself getting killed by his plasma breath.

title: rodney_aran
body:
The [[father]] of [[Samus Aran]] and husband of [[Virginia Aran]], who died during the [[Space Pirate (metroid)|]] raid of planet K-2L. 

In one of the ending images of [[Metroid Fusion]] he is shown firing upon a [[Ridley]] that is about to fire his plasma breath at him, while in the [[Metroid]] manga he instead sacrifices himself to self detonate the Afloraltite in order to blow up all the raiding Space Pirates forces, including Ridley.

title: x_parasite
body:
A gelatinous and nigh-unkillable parasite introduced in [[Metroid Fusion]], native to the planet SR-388. Capable of asexual reproduction and perfect [[imitating|mimicry]] after infecting and killing a host, utilizing all memories prior to the host's demise. There is no known limit to how many forms can be consumed and utilized by a single X, resulting in enhanced abilities should it desire more strength.

They would have stood at the top of the universe's food chain, if not for their bio-engineered predator- the [[Metroid (creature)|]].

h4. Appearance

* !asset #25600816

h4. See also
* [[SA-X]]

title: akaza_akari
body:
Sometimes nicknamed [I][[akkari~n|Akarin]][/I], Akari is supposedly the main protagonist of [[Yuru Yuri]]. However, as she is an ordinary person and often pales in comparison to the other characters, she is often bantered with her small presence and pushed into the background. Her friends often peg her character as having the ability to turn invisible and fire her '[[double bun|hair buns]]' like missiles. 

[[Toshinou Kyouko]] and [[Funami Yui]] are her childhood friends, while [[Yoshikawa Chinatsu]], [[Oomuro Sakurako]] and [[Furutani Himawari]] are some of her classmates.

Akari has an older sister named [[Akaza Akane]].

title: chozo_statue
body:
[[Statue]]s that appear throughout the [[Metroid]] series. 

They are relics of an ancient [[Chozo]] civilization, left behind on various planets to immortalize them. In the statues' hands are often [[orb]]s that carry [[power-up]]s for [[Samus Aran|Samus]] to acquire.

Rarely they can come alive and attack those who trespass. These are known as [b]Torizo[/b] only in the English [[Super Metroid]] strategy guides.

h4. Appearance
* !asset #25611382

title: ironmouse_outfit_art_contest
body:
The [i]Ironmouse Outfit Art Contest[/i] ran from January 13 to February 10, 2023, otherwise referred to by its hashtag name of the DressUpSayton Contest.

The contest was held so that viewers could make costume concepts for [[Ironmouse]], with the chosen winners being turned into proper models. Initially "slated":[https://twitter.com/ironmouse/status/1614034250092748807] to feature only five winners, a whopping 37 designs were chosen as winners upon the "reveal of the results":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=eyVhKZG1cT0] on March 12th. Each winner won $1,000 each.

Use this tag for the designs created as part of the contest, whether it be art of the winners or otherwise.

h4. Winners

Winners will be listed in order of model creation (and if they haven't gotten a model yet, they'll be listed in the order they appeared in the results stream).

* !asset #25407049: Bloom Angel
* !asset #22858418: Winter Doll
* !asset #22858421: Sweet Nightmares
* !post #7815438: Decora
* !asset #22858451: Infernal Cult Princess
* !asset #24589345: Moonlight Demon
* !post #9191604: Cyber Mouse

h4. External links

* Ironmouse Model Index: "Contest winners":[https://www.ironmousemodelindex.com/contest-winners]

title: ironmouse
body:
Puerto Rican [[virtual youtuber|VTuber]], mainly streaming in English. Has a genetically caused "immunodeficiency":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Common_variable_immunodeficiency]. Initially an [[indie virtual youtuber|indie]], has since become one of the founding members of [[VShojo]]. She also played as a member of [[Quackity SMP]]. She originally debuted using a "free FaceRig model":[https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1106528883] of [[Touhoku Kiritan]] in 2017 (now known as Season 0), before debuting her demon girl self in 2019. 

Being a [[demon girl]], she has [[demon wings]], [[demon horns|horns]] and a [[demon tail]].

For her regular hairstyle, she has her [[long hair|long]] [[pink hair|pink]] with [[purple hair|purple]] [[streaked hair|streaks]] done in a [[two side up]] and [[purple eyes]] (although in some outfits, she gains [[heterochromia]] with her left eye becoming [[red eyes|red]].)

title: old_bird
body:
Character from the [[Metroid]] manga. An elderly [[Chozo]] who raised [[Samus Aran]] along with [[Gray Voice]] following the death of her parents, though unlike Gray Voice he did not donate his DNA to be infused into Samus.

He first appeared in the non-canon Nintendo Power [[Super Metroid]] comic that was drawn and illustrated by [[Benimaru Itoh]], and is one of the few elements that later got carried over into the main canon.

title: hypnosis_mic:_alternative_rap_battle
body:
A mobile rhythm game based off the [[Hypnosis Mic]] franchise.

The protagonist is a [[protagonist_(hypnosis_mic:_alternative_rap_battle)|trainee DJ]] who is the apprentice of [[Doudantsutsuji Rokuro]]. After arriving at Chuohku to participate in the Alternative Rap Battle (the in-game analogue of the main series' Division Rap Battle), they become involved with four Division representatives, [[Buster Bros!!!]], [[MAD TRIGGER CREW]], [[Fling Posse]], and [[matenro_(hypnosis_mic)|Matenro]]. They also become acquainted with [[Dotsuitare Hompo]] and [[Bad Ass Temple]] in the Main Story's 2nd Season.

[b]Game-exclusive Characters[/b]
* [[protagonist_(hypnosis_mic:_alternative_rap_battle)|Protagonist]]
* [[Doudantsutsuji Rokuro]] 
* [[Nakiri Amiria]]
* [[Kankuchou Naozari]]
* [[Moudou Nue]]
* [[Aikuchi Mikuji]]
* [[Adaya Kanaria]]

The story is original to the game and is not considered a part of the mainline Hypnosis Mic canon.

h4. See also

* [[Hypnosis Mic]]
* [[Hypnosis Mic: Rule The Stage]]
