title: chozo_soldier
body:
Enemies in [[Metroid Dread]]. They are [[Chozo]] warriors of the Mawkin tribe, who retained their old warlike ways unlike the Thoha and other tribes. They wear [[armor]] similar to [[Samus Aran]]'s [[power suit (metroid)|]] with either a [[gold trim|gold]], [[silver trim|silver]] or [[red trim]], and fight with double-sided [[spear]]s.
[spoilers]The majority of soldiers seen in-game are infected by [[X parasite]]s, sprouting [[wide mouth]]s and attacking with black sludge during combat[/spoilers].

h4. Appearance
* !asset #25611731

title: sarashi
body:
A long, winding strip of cloth, usually thick cotton, wrapped tightly around the midriff up to the chest. Historically, samurai wore them under their kimono to resist injury.

In anime series, particularly in classic older ones, a delinquent character will be seen wearing one under their coat or unbuttoned shirt. The wrapping was a visible cue as to their general level of bad-assery.  In this form the sarashi is wound mostly around the abdomen.

Alternatively, a tomboyish girl may wear one to bind and/or flatten her breasts, especially if she is trying to pass as male.  This gradually evolved into what is nowadays the more common way of wearing a sarashi, which is in the style of a [[tube top]]; in this case, it wraps around only the chest area in a very nontraditional way, leaving the [[midriff]] bare (e.g. post #4296298, post #4076845, post #3616420, post #2644312). This sarashi style is especially seen on kendo girls and other fighters.

h4. Specific sarashi tags

* !post #6544025: [[Midriff sarashi]]
* !post #4185079: [[Chest sarashi]]
* !post #3845880: [[Midriff sarashi]] + [[Chest sarashi]]
* !post #2969475: [[Budget sarashi]]
* [[Undone sarashi]] - if the sarashi is unwrapped

h4. See also

* [[japanese clothes]]
* [[bandages]]
* [[bandeau]]
* [[tube top]]
* [[chest binder]]

title: durga_(fate)
body:
Archer-class Servant first debuted in [[Fate/Grand Order]]. One of the two major avatars of the [[Hindu mythology|Hindu]] mother goddess [[Parvati (fate)|]], alongsides [[Kali (fate)|]] (who she transforms into in her third ascension). This form represents Parvati as the "warrior goddess" and the protector of the universe. As with her base form, she uses [[Matou Sakura]] as her vessel.

Designed by [[starshadowmagician]] and voiced by [[Shitaya Noriko]].

title: protagonist_(hypnosis_mic:_alternative_rap_battle)
body: The main character of [[Hypnosis Mic: Alternative Rap Battle]]. An apprentice DJ training under [[Doudantsutsuji Rokuro]]. A war orphan who was rescued by [[Busujima Rio Mason]] before being approached by Rokuro. They work as a dishwasher at a bar in the backstreets of Yokohama called Port Harbor. Their design, personality, gender, and age are up to player's interpretation, though they are shown to be a somewhat helpful and kind person.

title: shoot_that_guy_(meme)
body:
Shoot That Guy refers to a reaction image of the character [[cmd don wardaddy collier|Wardaddy]], portrayed by actor [[Brad Pitt]], from the 2014 movie [[Fury (movie)|]] pointing his finger at a German officer who hanged children and ordering a soldier to shoot him. The image achieved virality as a reaction on social media in 2023, being used similarly to the [[Let's Kill Him (meme)|]] reaction. It is also sometimes recaptioned using the phrasal template "X That Guy" in which the first word is changed to different actions.

h4. External links
* "Know Your Meme:  Shoot That Guy":https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/shoot-that-guy

title: porkpie_hat
body:
A [[hat]] with a flat top and a slightly curved brim going all the way around the crown. It is similar to a [[fedora]] and [[trilby]], but it is shorter with no pinched front. Pork pie hats are often associated with jazz, blues and ska musicians and fans.

Do not confuse with [[boater hat]], boater hats have stiff brims and are often made of straw.

h4. Examples

* !post #8785341
* !post #6630394
* !post #6460763

h4. Non examples

* !post #9015629: [[Trilby]]. Notice how a taller crown makes it look sharper than a porkpie
* !post #8992939: [[Fedora]]. Non flat crown and wider brims
* !post #8999535: [[Boater hat]]. Has flat brims, often made of straw

h4. See also

* [[Tag Group:Attire]]

title: freudian_switch
body: A specific variation of [[freudian_slip|freudian slip]] where the person making the slip switches a line of internal thoughts with what they intended to say, usually resulting in them openly blurting out affection or irritation when they were trying to be more neutral.

title: freudian_slip
body:
When someone accidentally betrays subconscious thoughts (usually feelings of affection) in dialogue.

A more extensive gag will have someone thinking one line of thought while saying another, accidentally swapping the more private one for the other in the process (in both thought and speech balloons). Use the tag [[freudian_switch]] in that case.

title: sirin
body:
A [i][[Honkai Impact 3rd]][/i] and [i][[benghuai_xueyuan|Benghuai Xueyuan]][/i] character. The second Herrscher after [[Welt Joyce]], and dominated the power of the void. She became a Herrscher and started the Second Impact in 2000 at a Schicksal laboratory and has pulled the whole North Siberia into her void realm. Rumors say that she was inhumanely experimented on and tortured by the tests and therefore awakened the Herrscher consciousness inside of her and took the girl's mind.

Sirin perished together with S-rank Valkyrja [[Cecilia Schariac]] and four other A-rank Valkyries (Squad Snow Wolf) in a series of nuclear explosions caused by a rain of missiles from Schicksal.

After Sirin's death, her Herrscher core got been divided into five parts, those being the main Core of Void itself and the 4 extra Authorities granted to her, those being the Gem of Conquest (Thunder), Gem of Desire (Wind), Gem of Haste (Fire), and Gem of Serenity (Death). The four different Gems are kept separately by Schicksal and Anti-Entropy, while the Void Core was secretly obtained by Otto while everyone else was unaware of its existence.

In the current game era (Honkai Impact 3rd) [[Otto Apocalypse]] created [[kiana_kaslana|K-423]] (a clone of Kiana Kaslana mixed with Sirin's DNA) using the techniques he used for his adopted granddaughter [[Theresa Apocalypse]], and inserted the Void Core into the empty clone, successfully giving it life and Sirin a new body.

Sirin's soul/consciousness within the core then split into two: the side that wanted a happy life as Cecilia's daughter (K-423 Kiana), and the side that wanted revenge on the world ([[kiana_kaslana_(herrscher_of_the_void)|Void Kiana]]).

Thus was Sirin the Herrscher of the Void resurrected/reincarnated, just as Otto secretly planned. The Void's power doesn't normally show up, but in some special conditions, her power would burst dealing a large scale of destruction. The mysterious sound in Kiana's (K-423) head is actually Void Kiana's, her other self, but she doesn't have a clue.

She is named after the Russian mythological creature of the same name which is usually depicted as a beautiful half-woman, half-bird.

In version 5.0, an ELF form of her was released. In version 6.9, [[sirin (miracle magical girl)|Miracle Magical Girl]], a Magical Girl version of Sirin from a bubble world, became playable as a Mecha/Fire battlesuit.

title: edmond_dantes_(fate)
body:
Avenger-class Servant seen in [[Fate/Grand Order]]. Notable for being the first Avenger introduced in the game.

Edmond Dantes is the protagonist of [[Alexandre Dumas (fate)|]]' [i]"The Count of Monte Cristo":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Count_of_Monte_Cristo][/i]. Good-natured and innocent in the beginning, he is framed as a supporter of the exiled Napoleon Bonaparte and imprisoned.  In prison he befriends another political prisoner, a priest named Faria, who educates him. Dantes later escapes, and hardened by his experiences, he goes on to create a new identity for himself as the Count of Monte Cristo, and uses his new position to exact revenge on all those who wronged him in the past.

In [[Fate/Grand Order]] he does not consider himself as Dantes at all, rather as the vengeful King of the Cavern.

[b]Character Design[/b]: [[Komatsuzaki Rui]], [[Routo]] ([[The Count of Monte Cristo (fate)|]])
[b]Voice Actor[/b]: [[Shimazaki Nobunaga]]

title: the_protocols_of_the_elders_of_zion
body:
[b]The Protocols of the Elders of Zion[/b] is a fabricated text purporting to detail a Jewish plot for global domination. Largely plagiarized from several earlier sources, it was first published in Imperial Russia in 1903, translated into multiple languages, and disseminated internationally in the early part of the 20th century. It played a key part in popularizing belief in an international Jewish conspiracy.

h4.See also
* [[antisemitism]]

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: The Protocols of the Elders of Zion":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Protocols_of_the_Elders_of_Zion]

title: dress
body:
A one-piece garment worn on the torso and that hangs down over the legs. It consists of a bodice (the top part) attached to a skirt (the bottom).

Not to be confused with [[skirt]]. A dress is a single piece of clothing, while a [[skirt]] is a separate piece of clothing. Dresses should not be tagged with [[skirt]].

title: shaman
body:
[i]Shamanism[/i] ( /ˈʃɑːmən/ SHAH-mən or /ˈʃeɪmən/ SHAY-mən) is a practice that involves a practitioner reaching altered states of consciousness in order to encounter and interact with the spirit world. 

A [b]shaman[/b] is a person regarded as having access to, and influence in the world of benevolent and malevolent spirits, who typically enters into a trance state during a ritual, and practices divination and healing.

title: rebecca_(cyberpunk)
body:
A character from the [[Cyberpunk Edgerunners]] anime, set in the [[Cyberpunk_(series)|]] universe.

Rebecca is portrayed as a [[petite]] [[cyborg]] woman with [[green hair]] tied into [[twintails]], [[red_eyes|red]] [[mechanical eye|mechanical eyes]] with [[red sclera]], [[small breasts]], tattoos on her [[neck_tattoo|neck]], [[stomach_tattoo|stomach]] and [[leg_tattoo|leg]], and unnaturally [[white skin]]. Sometimes drawn with two mismatched [[mechanical hands]] with [[fewer digits]]. Usually depicted wearing a [[partially unzipped]] [[black_jacket|black]] [[samurai jacket (cyberpunk)|]], a [[black bra|black]] [[strapless bra|strapless]] [[bra]] and [[black panties]].

title: pope_francis
body:
Pope Francis (born Jorge Mario Bergoglio on 17 December 1936 - 21 April 2025) was the former 266th head of the Catholic Church, the bishop of Rome and sovereign of the Vatican City State. Was elected and became Pope on 13 March 2013 after his predecessor, Pope Benedict XVI, announced he would step down due to health issues. Notable for being the first Pope from the Americas and the Southern Hemisphere. Notable for his humility over pomp and grandeur, was sympathetic to the LGBT community and having friendly relationship with other religions and different Christian groups. Pope Francis died on 21 April 2025, Easter Sunday, after suffering from complications from pneumonia.

h4. See also

* [[Pope Francis Holding Things (Meme)]]
* [[Pope in White Puffer Jacket (Meme)]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Pope Francis":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pope_Francis

title: zenryoku_cheerleader_(idolmaster)
body:
"Zenryoku Cheer Girl" is one of the costumes from The Idolmaster Million Live. This costume is worn by the idols when they perform cheerleading routines. It is characterized by its vibrant and energetic design, which highlights the active side of the idols. Some idols have even performed solo live shows in this costume. In addition, merchandise such as keychains of idols wearing this costume are also sold. Zenryoku Cheer Girl can be said to be a costume that fully brings out the charm of The Idolmaster Million Live.

title: mate
body:
The [b]Mate[/b], also called [b]Mate Argentino[/b] is a type of [[tea]] [[drink]] native to Latin America, particularly [[Argentina]] (where is the most popular), [[Uruguay]] and [[Paraguay]]. 

It is made by soaking dried leaves of the holly species, yerba mate ([i]Ilex paraguariensis[/i]), in hot water and is served with a metal straw in a container typically made from a calabash gourd (the Mate proper), but also in some areas made from a cattle horn ([b]Guampa[/b]).

title: geara_doga
body:
A fictional  [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] series. It first appeared in the [[Char's Counterattack]] animated film from 1988.

[b]AMS-119 Geara Doga [/b]

A cheap, mass produced, conventional [[military]] [[mobile_suit|MS]] developed by [[Anaheim Electronics]] at [[Char Aznable]]'s request and inspired by the original [[Zaku]] line. A general purpose, versatile machine, if a bit lacking in the specs department, but good enough to fight more or less on par with the Federation's [[Jegan]]. 

Its shell was modified for two units to serve as Newtype use MSs and piloted by [[Gyunei Guss]] and [[Quess Paraya]] - those two units were then renamed the [[jagd_doga_gyunei_custom|Jagd]] [[jagd_doga_quess_custom|Doga]].

This mecha was succeeded by the [[Geara Zulu]]. 

h4.Related MS development
* [[Messer (Mobile Suit)]]
* [[Geara Doga Psycommu Test Type]]
* [[Psycho Doga]]

h4.See also
* [[Geara Doga Kai]]
* [[Geara Doga (Rezin Schnyder Custom)]]

title: dolmel_doue
body:
A fictional antagonist manned combat robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. It appears in the manga [[Mobile Suit Gundam Katana]].

[b]MS-19C Dolmel Doue[/b]

An advanced variant of [[Zeon]]'s [[Dolmel]] experimental [[mobile suit]] [spoiler]developed now by the [[Earth Federation]] after [[mobile_suit_gundam|The One Year War]] by using captured MS research data and by analizing the original Dolmel's wreckage and other remains[/spoiler].

title: shiranui_flare_(1st_costume)
body:
The default costume of [[hololive]]'s [[Shiranui Flare]].

It consists of a blue [[detached collar]] with a [[red bowtie]], a [[skirt set]] consistsing of a [[white shirt|white]] [[criss-cross halter|criss-cross]] [[halter shirt]] with a [[cleavage cutout]], a [[cutout above navel]] and [[criss-cross back-straps]], and a [[white skirt|white]] [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[bow skirt|bow]] [[miniskirt]] with a [[large bow|large]] [[back bow]], [[wide sleeves|wide]] [[white sleeves|white]] [[detached sleeves]],  [[white gloves|white]] [[half gloves]], [[white garter straps|white]] [[garter straps]] [[white thighhighs|thighhighs]] and [[blue shoes]].

Despite the name, this tag refers to her [i]current[/i] default costume, which she started using in December 12, 2021, and is her fourth chronologically. For the default costume she originally used when she first debuted, and the modified version she originally used for 3D streams, see [[Shiranui Flare (old design)]].

h4. Appearance

title: kamen_rider_decade
body:
Lead Rider of [[Kamen Rider DCD]], nineteenth show of the Kamen Rider series and tenth of the Heisei generation. The "Destroyer of Worlds".

[[Kadoya Tsukasa]] is an arrogant photographer with no memory of his past, driven to save his own dimension by traveling to 9 other dimensions under the protection of the 9 previous Heisei Riders. Using the [[Decadriver]], he transforms into Kamen Rider Decade.

Decade has a magenta color scheme, and is based on the shield bug [i]graphosoma lineatum[/i] and barcodes. He can transform into the nine previous Heisei Riders, as well as use their abilities via the [[Rider Card]]s. He can also transform into Decade Complete Form, which can conjure "doppelganger" versions of the nine previous Heisei Riders' final forms.

title: dragon_ball_z_fukkatsu_no_f
body:
[b]Dragon Ball Z: Resurrection 'F'[/b] is the nineteenth film based on the [[Dragon Ball]] series and the fifteenth to carry the [[Dragon Ball Z]] branding, released theatrically on April 18, 2015. It is the first Japanese film to be screened in IMAX 3D and receive screenings at 4DX theaters.

Resurrection 'F' is the second film personally supervised by series creator [[Toriyama Akira]], following [[Dragon Ball Z Kami to Kami|Battle of Gods]] in 2013, having written its screenplay. The movie depicts the return of the villain [[Frieza]], as well as the God of Destruction [[Beerus]] and [[Whis]] from Battle of Gods.

Due to Resurrection F's incorporation into [[Dragon Ball Super]] later that year, this tag should only be used for art specifically about the movie.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Dragon Ball Z: Resurrection 'F'":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dragon_Ball_Z:_Resurrection_'F']

title: base_cabba_(meme)
body:
A [[Dragon Ball]] powerscaling [[meme]] which developed out of discourse trying to figure out power levels between [[Dragon Ball Super]] (the anime in specific) and [[Dragon Ball GT]]. [[Cabba]], one of the characters introduced in Super, was able to compete with [[Vegeta]] in his base form. Vegeta, just like [[Son Goku|Goku]], had learned to utilize the power of [[Super Saiyan God]] in his base form (commonly referred to in the community as 'Saiyan Beyond God', conceptually introduced in [[Dragon Ball Z Fukkatsu no F|Resurrection F]], kept for the Super anime adaptation, and avoided in the Super manga adaptation), which meant that, in terms of powerscaling, Cabba could compete with [[Beerus]] much in the same way Goku had in [[Dragon Ball Z Kami to Kami|Battle of Gods]] and its Super adaptations, arguably a greater feat than anything shown in GT.

As a result, this begged the hilarious question on whether or not Cabba in his base form was stronger than GT's [[Super Saiyan 4]] [[Gogeta]].

title: rider_card
body: The collectable item of [[Kamen Rider DCD]], used with the [[Decadriver]] (and [[NeoDecadriver]]), the [[Diendriver]], and the [[Zein Driver]] in their one-time use Zein Card iteration. They are cards which contain the powers of past (or post-series) Kamen Riders, allowing one to transform into the Rider in question. When paired with the [[K-Touch]] (and [[K-Touch21]]), the cards can be used to access stronger forms.

title: kamen_rider_dcd
body:
Better known as Kamen Rider Decade, [b]Kamen Rider DCD[/b] is the 10th installment of the Heisei era Kamen Rider series. Closely tied with Kamen Rider Battle: Ganbaride, this series focuses on [[Kadoya Tsukasa]], the titular [[Kamen Rider Decade]], on his journey to save the Nine Worlds from evil.

The series aired from January 25, 2009 to August 30, 2009 on TV Asahi.

h4. See also

* [[Rider Card]]

title: tamagotchi
body:
A franchise of handheld "digital pet" devices released by [[Bandai]] in 1996. The [[tamagotchi (virtual pet)|device]] is egg-shaped and can be held in one hand. 

On the screen of the device shows a pixelated "pet" that can be taken care of via the buttons surrounding the device. The pet can get hungry, sleep, get sick, play, misbehave, etc., and the player must respond to these behaviors of the pet (or else the pet dies). 

Pets often have lifecycles and may die of old age. Gameplay varies from device to device.

title: ranger_key
body: The collectable item of [[Kaizoku Sentai Gokaiger]], used in tandem with the [[Mobilates]], or [[Gokai Cellular]] in [[Gokai Silver]]'s case. Alongside allowing to transform as the Gokaigers, they can transform into any past (or even post-series) Sentai Ranger as long as they have their respective key. They resemble a little figure of a given Sentai Ranger, whose legs flip up to reveal a key, which is then inserted into their transformation device of choice.

title: sunrise
body:
The [[sun]] crossing the [[horizon]] in the [[morning]]. If no sun is visible, tag it [[dawn]] or [[sunlight]] instead. Not to be confused with [[rising sun flag]].

Distinguishing between [[sunrise]] and [[sunset]] can be difficult, so only tag [[sunrise]] if the sky hues appear more white or yellow, as is most prevalent in media.

* !asset #24340888: Sunrise occurs after dawn

h4. See also

* [[sunset]]: the sun setting beneath the horizon
* [[dawn]]: time before sunrise with visible sunlight
* [[dusk]]: time after sunset with visible sunlight
* [[twilight]]: period between dawn-sunrise and sunset-dawn
* [[golden hour]]
* [[Sunrise (company)]] [tn] Anime studio [/tn]

title: sunset
body:
The [[sun]] setting beneath the [[horizon]] in the [[evening]]. If the sun is no longer visible, tag it [[dusk]] instead.

Distinguishing between [[sunrise]] and [[sunset]] can be difficult, so only tag [[sunset]] if the sky hues appear more orange or red, as is most prevalent in media.

* !asset #24340888: Sunset occurs before dusk

h4. See also

* [[sunrise]] the sun crossing the horizon in the morning
* [[dawn]]: time before sunrise with visible sunlight
* [[dusk]]: time after sunset with visible sunlight
* [[twilight]]: period between dawn-sunrise and sunset-dawn
* [[golden hour]]

title: montreal_expos
body: The Montreal Expos (French: Les expos de Móntreal) were a Major League Baseball team based in [[Montreal]], [[Quebec]], [[Canada]]. The Expos existed from 1969 to 2004. The team would relocate in 2005 to Washington D.C. to become the [[Washington Nationals]].

title: witch_bandora
body:
Witch Bandora is a villain in [[Kyouryuu Sentai Zyuranger]]. She was once the Queen of the Dall Tribe, who sold her soul to Dai-Satan for the power to avenge her son Kai, who was killed by a Tyrannosaurus for breaking its eggs. Unfortunately, in doing so she lost all memory of Kai, leading her to wage war on the other tribes and drive the dinosaurs to near-extinction before the Guardian Beasts sealed her and her followers away on the planet Nemesis. Years later, [[After 10000 Years I'm Free (meme)|a group of astronauts would unwittingly release them]], leading to Bandora resuming her mission to turn Earth into a barren wasteland, but was opposed by the Zyurangers, who had been put in magical stasis to awaken and protect the earth in the event of Bandora's escape.

Her counterpart in ([[Mighty Morphin Power Rangers|Mighty Morphin]]) [[Power Rangers]] is Rita Repulsa. Originally portrayed by Soga Machiko in both shows, albeit dubbed over by Barbara Goodson in Mighty Morphin, with Machiko even recording new scenes for the series' first two seasons (the footage often being referred to as "Zyu1.5":[https://www.grnrngr.com/zyu1.5/] & "Zyu2":[https://www.grnrngr.com/zyu2/]), before being replaced by Carla Perez that season, giving [[Lord Zedd]] a love potion and 'aging herself down slightly' as to marry him in that continuity.

h4. See also

* "Nicopedia":http://dic.nicovideo.jp/id/5078259

title: lord_drakkon
body: An evil and older version of [[Tommy Oliver]] from the [[Power Rangers (Boom! Studios)|Boom! Studios]] [[Power Rangers]] comics, who originates from an alternate reality, where he rules his Earth with an iron fist from a dystopiac and futuristic Angel Grove, controlling the [[Black Dragon (power rangers)|]] and battles the Power Rangers.

title: tommy_oliver
body:
A [[Power Rangers]] character, best known as the original [[Mighty Morphin Green Ranger|Mighty Morphin Green]] & [[Mighty Morphin White Ranger|White Ranger]] in [[Mighty Morphin Power Rangers]] (additionally serving as the Mighty Morphin-unique [[White Ninja Ranger]]). He would go on to be the longest-serving Power Ranger in the entire franchise, serving as [[Zeo Ranger V Red]] in [[Power Rangers Zeo]], the original [[Red Turbo Ranger]] in [[Power Rangers Turbo]], and the [[Black Dino Ranger]] in [[Power Rangers Dino Thunder]], as well as returning in one of these suits in [[Power Rangers Wild Force]], [[Power Rangers S.P.D.]], [[Power Rangers Megaforce|Power Rangers Super Megaforce]], and [[Power Rangers Ninja Steel|Power Rangers Super Ninja Steel]]. He was played by the late [[Jason David Frank]].

An alternate version of Tommy would appear in the [[Power Rangers (boom! Studios)|Boom! Studios]] comics, where he acts as [[Lord Drakkon]], serving as the primary antagonist in the Shattered Grid event (and its adaptation in [[Power Rangers: Battle For The Grid]]).

title: power_rangers_hyperforce
body:
A tabletop RPG launched as part of [[Power Rangers]]' 25th anniversary. It is streamed live by Hyper RPG on popular video game streaming platform Twitch.

Set in the year 3016 at Time Force Academy, a team of Time Force Ranger cadets must band together to defeat an ancient evil who is set on unraveling the very fabric of the universe. Under the leadership of their mentor, [b]Jen Scotts[/b], and with the show’s Game Master, Malika Lim, the newly minted Rangers will cross both time and space to complete their mission while running into many familiar eras (and faces) along the way.

title: hyde_(fate)
body:
The secondary personality of [[Jekyll and Hyde (fate)|]] that manifests after [[Henry Jekyll (fate)|]] uses his [[Noble Phantasm (fate)|]] [b]Dangerous Game[/b].

In [[Fate/Prototype: Fragments of Blue and Silver]], the transformation results in him appearing as a [[werewolf]]-like creature. After being corrupted by the [[Holy Grail (fate)|]], he becomes the dominant personality and can temporarily maintain a human form for only an hour at a time.

In [[Fate/Grand Order]], the transformation keeps him in a human form, but he switches his class from Assassin to Berserker.

title: jekyll_and_hyde_(fate)
body:
A Berserker-class appearing in [[Fate/Prototype: Fragments of Blue and Silver]]. He later appears as an Assassin-class servant in [[Fate/Grand Order]].

[[Henry Jekyll (Fate)|]] is the neat-looking one, while [[Hyde (Fate)|]] has [[red eyes]], [[messy hair]], an unbuttoned vest and a [[blood stain]] on his shirt. They both use a knife in combat.

In [[Fate/Grand Order]], Jekyll starts as an Assassin, and when he changes to Hyde via his Noble Phantasm, he becomes a Berserker.

[b]True Name:[/b] Dr. Henry Jekyll & Mr. Edward Hyde

title: m78_fuwafuwa
body:
A line of [[Ultra Series]] [[character doll]]s that debuted in "September 2020":[https://twitter.com/ultraman_shop/status/1306918028043460614], featuring the various Ultras, as well as both allies and kaiju. Their full proper name are "M78 Ultraman Fuwafuwa o Suwari Nuigurumi", often shortened to just "M78 Fuwafuwa". They are based on the SD Ultraman style 'M78 Ultraman' designed by Nakata Kazuyuki, originally for [[Bandai]], starting from 1990 (with the designs featuring in merchandising, as well as in the 1999 short anime film Ultraman M78 Gekijou Love & Peace).

Commonly referred to as fuwa(fuwa)s, the release of the plushes inspired a whole wave of fanart based on the M78 Ultraman artstyle, sometimes emphasizing this inspiration by adding plush-like fuzzy lines to the characters. A parallel set of plushes exist, referred to as "M78 [[mochimochi mascot|Mochimochi]]" (or in full "M78 Ultraman Mochimochite Nori Nuigurumi"), which render the plushes as flying rather than sitting. They are included under this tag.

Use this tag for both the plushes, as well as art in the style of the plushes. Though the original M78 Ultraman style also remains popular (with a theme park using the style existing since 2008, for example), art inspired by the plushes generally renders the characters much rounder.

h4. External links

* "Collection M78 Ultraman: Tracing the History of M78 Ultraman (Japanese)":https://m78ultramania.hatenablog.com/entry/2023/04/16/175030
* "ULTRAMAN OFFICIAL SHOP: 特集 - ＃ふわふわといっしょ (2024/04)":https://www.m78-online.net/page/202404_fuwafuwa.html

title: list_of_pokemon_characters
body:
Tagged human characters in [i][[pokemon|Pokémon]][/i]. This includes characters from games, manga and anime.

See the wiki of [i][[pokemon|Pokémon]][/i] for important naming conventions.

See [[list of Pokemon]] for the creatures.

title: konori_mii
body:
[[ToAru Kagaku no Railgun]] character. Level 3 esper and chief of the 177th Branch of [[judgement armband (toaru)|Judgment]] where [[Uiharu Kazari]] and [[Shirai Kuroko]] work.

She has [[blue eyes]] and [[medium hair|medium]] [[black hair]].

title: uiharu_kazari
body:
Character from the anime/manga series [[ToAru Kagaku No Railgun]]. She is a friend of [[Shirai Kuroko]] and a classmate of [[Saten Ruiko]] at [[Sakugawa school uniform|Sakugawa Middle School]].

Kazari's ability as an esper is limited to keeping lunches warm by using her Level 1 Thermal Hand to keep things at constant temperature. However, she is infamous as a fearsome hacker, nicknamed "Goalkeeper", and is invaluable as an asset of [[Judgement armband (toaru)|Judgment]] and Kuroko's primary operator.

She has [[short hair|short]] [[black hair]] and [[brown eyes]]. She usually wears a [[flower wreath|flower]] [[head wreath]].

title: shirai_kuroko
body:
A character from the light novel series [[Toaru Majutsu No Index]] and its spin-off manga series [[Toaru Kagaku No Railgun]].

Roommate of [[Misaka Mikoto]] and member of "[[Judgement armband (toaru)|Judgement]]", Academy City's student-based disciplinary committee. Kuroko is a Level 4 esper with the power to instantly teleport herself or items in her possession. Has an almost obsession-like crush on Mikoto, much to the latter's annoyance.

She has [[brown eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] tied in [[twintails]] with [[red bow|red]] [[hair bow]]s.

She is sometimes seen holding [[throwing needles]].

title: salvatore_ganacci
body:
Salvatore Ganacci (real name: Emir Kobilić) is a Bosnian-Swedish [[DJ|disc jockey]] and record producer, specialized in EDM and dancehall music, among other genres. He is also known for his "meme-worthy live performances":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CA_0rWc-mZg] and music videos, featuring surrealist humor.

Salvatore was announced as a core collaborator on [[Fatal Fury: City of the Wolves]], a 2025 fighting game by [[SNK]]. Not only was he instrumental as a music collaborator, both in-game and marketing, but he also features as a playable guest character, with a move list and presentation referencing his works.
other_names: サルバトーレ・ガナッチ

title: gentoo
body:
[b]Gentoo Linux[/b] (pronounced [i]JEN[/i]-too) is a [[Linux]] distribution built using the Portage package management system.

Gentoo lets the user build their system from the ground up by compiling programs from their source code. This approach allows tailoring software to work best with the [[computer]]'s hardware.

The operating system lets the user choose which features to include or exclude while installing software using a keyword tool called USE flags. 

It also uses a rolling release system, meaning it continuously updates software without the need for major upgrades. While it is considered by many to be challenging to install and set up than other Linux systems, it comes with extensive documentation and a helpful community for support.

h4. External links
* "Official website":[https://www.gentoo.org/]
* "Wikipedia: Gentoo Linux":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gentoo_linux]

title: team_rocket
body:
A crime syndicate in the [[pokemon|Pokémon]] media, most notably appeared as a recurring antagonist in the [[pokemon (anime)|the anime adaptation]].

Their uniforms are black with a red "R" on the chest, and topped with a flat cap eye mask. Exception comes in the frequent Rocket team in the anime, which have white clothes with no extra accessories.

This tag should only apply to group pictures of Team Rocket members or pictures directly referencing the organization, logos, [[Team Rocket Uniform]], ect. This tag should not apply to solo members of the group out of uniform.

title: yumeno_himiko
body:
Character from [i][[Danganronpa V3: Killing Harmony]][/i].

The Ultimate Magician. She claims she is actually a mage, and her title as magician was only to help cover the existence of magic to the public. She is also very lazy, often calling things a pain and complaining that she doesn’t have enough MP for everyday tasks. Has an affinity for tight spaces. Often seen with [[Chabashira Tenko]].

She has [[short_hair|short]] [[red hair]] in a [[bob cut]], wears a [[black_hat|black]] [[witch hat]] and a [[hairclip]] adorned with a [[blue_gemstone|blue]] [[gem_hair_ornament|gem]]. Her [[school uniform]] consists of a [[black_jacket|black]] [[blazer]] with [[grey_sleeve_cuffs|grey accents]], a [[brown vest]], a [[red_skirt|red]] [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[miniskirt]], and [[pointy_boots|pointy]] [[brown boots]] with [[white_ribbon|white ribbons]] tied around her [[footwear_ribbon|ankles]]. On the pocket of her blazer is an [[insignia]] of her previous high school. She also carries around a [[staff]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #9156655

title: black_canary
body: Black Canary is the name of two superheroines appearing in American comic books published by [[DC Comics]]. As one of the earliest female superheroes in the DC Comics universe, the character has made numerous appearances in prominent team-up titles, including the Justice Society of America and [[Justice League]] of America. The Black Canary persona has been adopted by two individuals, portrayed as a legacy heroes with a mother-daughter relationship between the two. Following DC's New 52 initiative, Black Canary was briefly amalgamated as a single character before the mother-and-daughter dynamic was restored to continuity, the history formerly established retroactively added as part of the second Black Canary's history.

title: zucchetto
body:
A small round skullcap worn by [[Christianity|Christian]] clergymen. Typically associated with clergymen of the [[Catholic|Catholic Church]], though is also worn in the Syriac Orthodox Church and some Protestant churches. It is customary for the zuchetto to be worn under the [[biretta]] and [[mitre]]. 

In Catholicism, the [[pope]] has a white zuchetto, and cardinals have a red zuchetto. It can also be seen in purple and black, typically by bishops and [[priest]]s/deacons respectively.

Also known as a pilelous, its official name, but also sometimes designated as a berettino, calotte, subbiretum, submitrale, or soli-deo.

body:
Also known as "If You're Over 25 and Own a Computer, This Game Is a Must-Have", and "Must-Play Tree", refers to clickbait ads for several browser games, originally [[Stormfall:_Age_of_War]], that feature a human-faced [[tree]] character and a [[knight]] [[kneeling]] in front of it, with the text often claiming that if you're above a certain age and own a computer, then you must try the game. It gained popularity as a video caption and remix format, and have often been combined with the composition "Secunda" from the [[the elder scrolls v: skyrim|Skyrim]] soundtrack.

title: kebaya
body:
A traditional blouse-dress combination that originated from the court of the Javanese Majapahit Kingdom, and is traditionally worn by women in Indonesia, Malaysia, Singapore, Brunei, southern Thailand, Cambodia and the southern part of the Philippines.

The kebaya is the [[indonesian clothes|national costume of Indonesia]], although it is more accurately endemic to the Javanese, Sundanese and Balinese peoples.

title: scorpion_deathlock
body:
A professional wrestling submission hold also known as [b]Sharpshooter[/b] elsewhere.

This hold begins with the opponent supine on the mat with the applying wrestler stepping between the opponent's legs with his/her left leg and wraps the opponent's legs at shin level around that leg. If the applier decides to cross the opponent's legs around his right leg, he has to cross the opponent's right leg over their left, or, otherwise, he has to cross his opponent's left leg over their right. Holding the opponent's legs in place, the wrestler then grabs the opponent's leg which he has crossed over the other and steps over him, flipping him over into a prone position before leaning back to compress his lower back.

Its original name is [i]Sasori-gatame[/i] (Japanese for "Scorpion Hold") and is invented by Choushuu Riki. [[Sting (wrestler)|Sting]] then popularized it in the United States under the name [i]Scorpion Deathlock[/i] and later on, [[Bret Hart]] adopted it under the name [i]Sharpshooter[/i]. [[All Elite Wrestling]] wrestler Daniel Garcia does a bridging variation which he calls the [I]Dragon Tamer[/I].
other_names: スコーピオンデスロック

title: oathkeeper

[spoiler]The Oathkeeper is formed when Sora uses Kairi's Wayfinder as a Keychain. After rescuing her from Hollow Bastion in Kingdom Hearts, Kairi gives him the charm for luck in the Secret Waterway in Traverse Town.[/Spoiler]

title: monster_house
body: Monster House is a 2006 American animated supernatural horror comedy film directed by Gil Kenan in his directorial debut, from a screenplay written by Pamela Pettler and the writing team of Dan Harmon and Rob Schrab based on a story written by the latter two. The plot revolves around a neighborhood being terrorized by a sentient haunted house during [[Halloween]].

title: toned
body:
A character who has a toned or athletic build, but is not overly [[muscular]].

A [[toned]] body has little fat and may have well developed [[abs]], but the overall visible musculature of the character should look slim or athletic, not buff or bulky. Think track and field, not body building.

Do not use together with the [[muscular]] tag when describing one character. 

* [b] Comparison with [[muscular]][/b]
Details like bulkiness of the [[thick arms |arms]], [[thick neck|neck]], [[v-taper|waist]], and [[broad shoulders]] are a good way to distinguish between [[toned]] and [[muscular]] builds.

[i]Do not use [/i][[pectorals]] size alone as a determinant for this tag. It is common to draw them disproportionately to the rest of the body, especially with [[manboobs]] etc.

* !post #7055700
* !asset #13418660

title: shikinagi_akira_(3rd_costume)
body:
The 3rd [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[Nijisanji]]'s [[Shikinagi Akira]], as seen on "Twitter":[https://twitter.com/Shikinagi_2434/status/1899088375124312203/photo/1]. Unlike his past costumes that were designed by his original artist ([[Nozaki Tsubata]]), this one was designed by [[Kyo Zip]].

It consists of a black multicolored [[tangzhuang]], a [[white belt]] with a [[belt pouch|pouch]], [[white pants]] with a gradient [[pelvic curtain]], [[black shoes|black]] [[flats]] and a pair of [[purple-tinted eyewear|purple-tinted]] [[glasses]]. He also wears a [[bead necklace]] with a [[tassel]], [[tassel earrings]], a [[bead bracelet]] and has [[multicolored nails|multicolored]] [[black nails|black]] and [[yellow nails]]. Often seen smoking a [[hookah]].

title: kamen_rider_build
body:
Titular protagonist of [i][[Kamen Rider Build (series)|]][/i], Sento Kiryu is an amnesiac scientist working for Touto, one of the three governments of a Japan physically and politically split by a massive wall created by the Pandora's Box, a mysterious artifact brought from Mars. Besides scientific work, he also moonlights as Build, fighting off the Smash, mutated humans experimented upon by the mysterious Faust organization.

As Build, Sento uses Fullbottles, which were his own creation, to change his appearance and combat capabilities, using a combination of Fullbottles based on organic and inorganic matter, such as his default blue-and-red [[Kamen Rider Build (RabbitTank form)|RabbitTank]] form.

title: ceres_fauna
body:
A former [[Virtual Youtuber|VTuber]], part of [[hololive English]]'s [[holoCouncil|2nd]] [[holoPromise|generation]]. The keeper of the Earth's nature, she's a [[qilin (mythology)|]] girl who was born at the same time of Earth's creation and became its guardian. Designed by [[Toosaka Asagi]]. 

On December 1st, 2024, "she announced":[https://www.youtube.com/live/6DolP8msG14] that she would be graduating from hololive, with a "graduation stream":[https://www.youtube.com/live/OFIVy79pgWc] on January 3rd, 2025.

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[green hair]] with a [[gradient hair|gradient]] towards dark green and dark green [[streaked hair|streaks]] and small [[hair flower]]. She also has [[antlers]], [[yellow eyes]], [[large breasts]], and a [[mole under eye|mole under her right eye]]. Her default hairstyle consists of a [[one side up]] with [[long bangs|long]] [[asymmetrical bangs]] with one side being [[braided bangs|braided]] and the other [[hair over one eye|covering her left eye]].

h4. Costumes

She also wears a [[blue gloves|blue]] [[single bridal gauntlet]], a [[single thighhigh|single]] [[stirrup legwear|stirrup]] [[white thighhighs|white thighhigh]] on her left leg and an [[anklet]] on her right leg.

body:
The 4th and final [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive English|hololive EN]]'s [[Ceres Fauna]]. Themed after her "[[goth fashion|Goth Fauna]]" persona.

It consists of a [[black choker|black]] [[heart choker|heart]] [[o-ring choker|o-ring]] [[o-ring choker|choker]], multiple [[necklace]]s, a [[chest harness]], a [[short dress|short]] [[black dress|black]] [[frilled dress|frilled]] [[strapless dress]] with a [[see-through dress layer|see through layer]], a [[crinoline]], [[black sleeves|black]] [[detached sleeves|detached]] [[lace sleeves]], [[black thighhighs|black]]/[[brown thighhighs|dark brown]] [[see-through thighhighs|see-through]] [[fishnet thighhighs]] held with a [[single legwear garter]] with an [[heart o-ring|heart]] [[o-ring thigh strap]] and [[black boots|black]] [[lace-up boots|lace-up]] [[platform boots]]. She now also has multiple [[spike piercing|spike]] [[ear piercing]], an [[earclip]] and [[earrings]]. She also has an optional [[black shirt|black]] [[print shirt|print]] [[t-shirt]], [[glasses]] and [[horn ribbon]]s.

She has 3 different [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyles]] in this costume, 2 options have with a [[green hair|dark green]] [[gradient hair|gradient]] and features [[long bangs|long]] [[asymmetrical bangs]] [[hair over one eye|over her left eye]], a pair of [[hairclip]]s, and the usual [[hair flower]]s:
* [[Short hair]] cut in a [[bob cut]]
* [[Very long hair|Very long]] [[straight hair]] 
* [[Long hair]] from her [[ceres fauna (jirai kei)|Jirai Kei]] outfit

title: pepe_(arknights)
body:
[i]The archaeologist Pepe digs into the past buried by sand.[/i]

A playable Guard Operator in [[Arknights]].

Real Name: Djerwnapekhaper Saciut Hatshepsut

h4. Profile
[expand]
[table]
[tbody]
      [tr][td]Place of Birth:[/td]
      [td]Sargon[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Birthday:[/td]
      [td]June 12[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Race:[/td]
      [td]Feline[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Height:[/td]
      [td]155 cm[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Combat Experience:[/td]
      [td]3 years[/td][/tr]
  [/tbody]
[/table]
[/expand]

A renowned archaeologist and historian who work to uncover and preserve the history of Sargon.
The eldest daughter of the Hatshepsut royal family, and distant descendant of the [[lugalszargus_(arknights)|first Shahanshah]].
Now aiding Rhodes Island as a field operator.

First appeared as an NPC in the "Reclamation Algorithm" gamemode [i]Tales Within the Sand[/i], she later became a playable operator and the main character of the side story [i]Adventure That Cannot Wait for the Sun: Inudi Harek, Horakhet[/i].

Her motif is based on the Abyssinian [[cat]].

Her [[voice actor]]s are [[Saitou Machiko]] (Japanese), Chen Tingting (Chinese), Sophia Eleni (English), and 
Seo Da-hye (Korean). Her illustrator is [[Namie-kun]].

title: forever_young_(racehorse)
body:
[tn]Named after a song by AK-69 feat UVERWorld. It follows his dam's name as well.[/tn]
Japanese racehorse. Sired by [[Real Steel (racehorse)|]] and foaled by Forever Darling.

He is famous for winning the 2023 Zen-Nippon Nisai Yushun and being undefeated until the 2024 Kentucky Derby, where he finished third in a photo-finish, behind winner Mystik Dan and runner-up Sierra Leone.

Forever Young's birthday falls on the same day as the release of the [[Umamusume]] game, February 24, 2021. A significant date for his owner, Fujita Susumu, CEO of CyberAgent, [[Cygames]]' parent company.

h4. Further reading:
* "Wikipedia:  Forever Young (horse)":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Forever_Young_(horse)]

title: gm_sniper_iii
body:
A fictional manned giant robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. It appears in [[Advance of Zeta]].

[b]RGM-79SR GM Sniper III[/b]

A [[titans_(gundam)|Titans]] long range support [[mobile_suit|MS]] derived from the  [[Earth Federation]] [[GM Kai]] but equipped with a long-range [[beam rifle]] and an [[assault visor]] which contains high-performance optical targeting equipment. The GM Sniper III's sensors, thrusters, and other systems were upgraded to match the specifications of the EF [[GM II]].

It's a [[jirai kei]]-themed outfit consisting of a [[black choker|black]] [[lace-trimmed choker|lace-trimmed]] [[heart choker]], a [[brown cardigan|beige]] [[open cardigan]] with [[cross-laced sleeves]], a [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[white shirt|white]] [[frilled shirt]] with [[center frills]], a [[frilled shirt collar]] with a [[purple ribbon|purple]] [[neck ribbon]] and a [[cleavage cutout]], a [[black skirt|black]] [[high-waist skirt]] [[suspender skirt|suspender]] [[miniskirt]] with a [[see-through skirt layer|see-through]] [[overskirt|outer layer]] [[white socks|white]] [[bobby socks]] and [[black footwear|black]] [[platform footwear|platform]] [[mary janes]].

On September 2023 she got an optional [[brown capelet]] [[fur-trimmed capelet|fur-trimmed]] [[hooded capelet]] with a [[deer hood]].

On January 20, 2024. she got another update for this outfit that replaces the usual cardigan with a [[pink cardigan|pink]] [[aran sweater]] and adds an optional [[black hairband|black]] [[cat ear hairband]] with [[lace ears]].

title: arm_bump
body: Like a [[fist bump]], but with the forearms, either parallel or in an X shape. Often used in a triumphal context, as when a couple of characters have just pulled off a badass combo move. If anything, even more bro-coded.

title: cannongan
body:
A fictional manned giant robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. It appears in [[Gundam UC 0096: Last Sun]].

[b]RIX-003 Cannongan[/b]

A remodeled RGM-89A2 [[Jegan]] Type-A2 built by [[Anaheim Electronics]] and designed in the likeness of the RX-77 [[Guncannon]]. 

Like the RIX-001 [[Gundam G-First]] and RIX-00PT [[GF-Tank]], it was developed as a test machine for design verification. It was used in the ceremony being held at Side 7.

title: curled_up
body:
A body position where someone [[sitting|sits]] or [[lying|lies]] with their arms and legs close to them. Generally [[legs together|legs are together]] or [[knees together feet apart| knees are together]] with the arms close to the chest, often [[hugging own legs|hugging the legs]]. The back may be [[bent back|rounded]] or just [[leaning forward]] slightly.

This tag also aplies to [[animal]]s and [[creature]]s curled up while [[sleeping]].

title: gf-tank
body:
A fictional manned combat robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. It appears in [[Gundam UC 0096: Last Sun]].

[b]RIX-00PT GF-Tank[/b]

A D-50C [[Loto]] that was originally produced by SNRI and was heavily remodeled by [[Anaheim Electronics]]. 

Like the RIX-001 [[Gundam G-First]] and RIX-003 [[Cannongan]], it was produced for the ceremony taking place at Side 7, in practice meant to invoke the visage of the classic RX-75 [[Guntank]].

body:
A fictional manned giant robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. It appears in [[Gundam UC 0096: Last Sun]].

[b]RIX-001 Gundam G-First[/b]

A powerful experimental combat [[mobile suit]] developed by [[Anaheim Electronics]] at the request of the [[Earth Federation]] Ground Forces, alongside the RIX-003 [[Cannongan]] and RIX-00PT [[GF-Tank]]. 

Its design was based on data from the [[nu_gundam_mp_type|RX-94 Mass Production Type ν Gundam]].

title: gundam_uc_0096:_last_sun
body:
[b]Mobile Suit Gundam U.C. 0096: Last Sun[/b] is a [[GUNDAM]] manga sequel to [[gundam_uc_0094:_across_the_sky|Mobile Suit Gundam U.C. 0094: Across The Sky (2012)]] illustrated by [[Katsumoku]]. 

It was officially launched in [[Gundam Ace]] magazine first in December 2014, continuing in its February 2015 issue and later ending in August, 2017. 

Although sometimes promoted as a side-story of Mobile Suit [[Gundam Unicorn]], the story is independent of it, though several MS from that series make an appearance.

h4. Featured MS
* [[Gundam G-First]]
* [[Cannongan]]
* [[GF-Tank]]

title: crime_scene
body:
A place where a crime has been committed and forensic evidence may be gathered, it's implied that [[police]] is investigating the place. Some common features in a crime scene are [[evidence markers]], [[chalk outline]] and [[caution tape]].

h4. Examples

* !post #6753188

h4. See also

* [[blood]]
* [[corpse]]
* [[death]]
* [[implied murder]]
* [[on floor]]
* [[on ground]]

title: q_(tribe_nine)
body:
A member of the Trash Tribe who is primarily seen around [[Aoyama Kazuki]], a close friend of his that he's known for a long time. His appearance consists of [[pale skin]], [[short hair|short]] [[grey hair]], [[grey eyes]], [[bags under eyes|deep eye bags]], [[black coat]], [[torn hoodie|torn]] [[white hoodie]] and [[baggy pants|baggy]] [[black pants]].

[spoilers]His former identity is [[Otori Ojirou]], which he abandoned when he disappeared from the public eye after his defeat against the Minato Tribe. As of chapter 3 of the game he revealed himself to be Otori Ojirou to the entirety of Neo Chiyoda.[/spoilers]

* !post #8854226

title: otori_ojirou
body:
The leader of the Chiyoda Tribe who also serves as the main antagonist of [[Tribe Nine]]. His appearance consists of [[short hair|short]] [[white hair]] with a single black [[streaked hair|streak]], [[red sclera]] with [[white eyes]], [[mask]], [[black coat]], [[black cape]], [[black pants]] and [[black boots]].

[spoilers]After his defeat against the Minato Tribe he disappeared from the public eye and changed his appearance and name to [[Q (Tribe Nine)|Q]], abandoning his former identity.[/spoilers]

other_names: 真ゲッターロボ対ネオゲッターロボ

title: you_are_the_perfect_ultimate_getter_(meme)
body:
2023 [[meme]] involving the theme songs of [[Oshi no Ko]] and [[Shin Getter Robo vs Neo Getter Robo]], [[YOASOBI]]'s [[IDOL (YOASOBI)|]] and [[JAM Project]]'s [i]STORM[/i] respectively. Some older viewers of the former anime noticed a melodic similarity between IDOL and STORM around the section where the lyrics "you are the perfect ultimate Idol" are sung, to the section in the latter where the word "GETTER" is yelled out, prompting an edit having one lead into the other being posted on "Twitter":[https://twitter.com/9LOAtu47Ey7sI6s/status/1648636529487802370] ("NND repost":[https://www.nicovideo.jp/watch/sm42134272]) and going viral. The meme would inspire some fanart mixing Oshi no Ko with Getter Robo.

Following the reveal of [[Gundam GQuuuuuuX]]'s theme song, [[Yonezu Kenshi]]'s [i]Plazma[/i], in 2025, the meme was extended to feature the song after a meme post on "Twitter":[https://twitter.com/pengin0808/status/1887136913758576730] went viral and inspired "an edit":[https://www.nicovideo.jp/watch/sm44620435] with the song per its specifications.
other_names: 君は完璧で究極のゲッター

title: dc_comics
body:
[b]DC Comics[/b] is one of the largest and oldest [[united_states|American]] [[comic]] book publishing houses, founded in 1934. Rival to [[Marvel]] Comics (even though both release crossover comics from time to time).

The majority of its publications take place within the DC Universe and feature numerous iconic superheroes and villains, including [[Superman]], [[Batman]], [[Wonder Woman]], [[The Flash]], [[Green Lantern]], and [[Aquaman (dc)|]].

title: implacable_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the [[Royal Navy]] aircraft carrier HMS [i]Implacable[/i] (R86). Character designed by [[Kincora]] and voiced by [[Yukana]]. 

She has [[very long hair|very long]] [[blonde hair]], [[red eyes]], and [[large breasts]]. 

Her default outfit is a [[nun]] habit, white dress top and black [[pelvic curtain]], [[white thighhighs]], [[black gloves]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[high heels]]. Her [[rigging]] consists of a large golden [[cross]] to her back with [[chain]]s, white [[wings]], and [[statue]]s, a long black wrap meant to serve as her [[flight deck]], and four 113 mm twin [[anti-aircraft gun|DP mounts]].

body:
Wearing a shirt or top with no [[bra]]. Common situations include wearing a [[see-through clothes|see-through]] shirt without a bra, or having a [[shirt lift]] or [[open shirt]] reveal the character isn't wearing a bra.

Don't use when the character is [[nude]], completely [[topless female|topless]], wearing clothing not normally worn with a bra, or otherwise isn't expected to be wearing a bra.

title: no_panties
body:
Wearing a [[skirt]], [[dress]], [[shorts]], or other similar clothing but with no [[panties]] or [[underwear]].

Don't use when the character is [[nude]], completely [[bottomless]], wearing clothing not normally worn with [[panties]], or otherwise isn't expected to be wearing [[panties]].

Use {{pool:no_panties?|No Panties?}} when it's heavily implied that the character is pantyless, but you can't tell for sure.

title: oguri_cap_(umamusume)
body:
Character from [[Umamusume]].

Nicknamed the "Grey Monster", Oguri Cap is a talented racer with very modest origins, has a strong heartbeat and a [[glutton|ravenous appetite]]. [[oguri_cap_(racehorse)|The actual horse]] is named after his sire: Dancing [i]Cap[/i]. 

Oguri has her own spin-off manga titled [[Umamusume: Cinderella Gray]], which has since been adapted into an Anime.

As noted, her most salient trait is her appetite, a trait taken from the actual horse. It's often the only trait that is outwardly displayed, often to the point of eating absurd amounts of food as well as trying to eat things that aren't food or other people.

title: schlecht_the_defiant_soul
body:
Monster card introduced in the [[Yu-Gi-Oh! Rush Duel]] card game. 

Card type:  Monster
Attribute:  WIND
Types:  Zombie / Effect
Level:  3
ATK / DEF:  1200 / 0
Status: Legal (Rush Duel)

[b]CARD DESCRIPTION:[/b] [REQUIREMENT]: Send 1 monster from your hand to the Graveyard.
[EFFECT]: Change the battle position of 1 monster on your opponent's field.
Then, if you have 5 or more monsters in your Graveyard, you can add 1 "Guyghast the Defiant Soul" from your Graveyard to your hand.

title: agasa_hiroshi
body:
A character from [[Meitantei Conan]]. A genius inventor who is the first person to learn of [[Kudou Shin'ichi]] being shrunk as a child. He helps Shin'ichi by maintaining his identity as [[Edogawa Conan]] and inventing various gadgets for Conan to apprehend culprits.

His name comes from detective fiction writer [[Agatha Christie]].

Voiced by [[Ogata Ken'ichi]].

title: kamen_rider_agito
body:
Lead Rider of [[Kamen Rider Agito (series)|]], eleventh show of the Kamen Rider series and second of the Heisei generation.

Tsugami Shouichi is a mysterious man who one day washed ashore with no memories, having taken his name from a letter found with him. For some reason he can transform into the mystic warrior Agito to fight the Lords, monsters responsible for mysterious deaths throughout Tokyo.

Agito's default form, [[Agito (Ground Form)|Ground Form]], has a black-and-gold color scheme, but can also change forms to suit combat situations - the red [[Agito (Flame Form)|Flame Form]], the blue [[Agito (Storm Form)|Storm Form]], the fused [[Agito (Trinity Form)|Trinity Form]], and the final [[Kamen Rider Agito (Burning Form)|Burning]] and [[Kamen Rider Agito (Shining Form)|Shining Form]]s.

h4. See also

* [[Altering (Agito)|]] ([[Rider belt]])

* [[Agito (Trinity Form)|Trinity Form]]
* [[Kamen Rider Agito (Burning Form)|Burning Form]]
* [[Kamen Rider Agito (Shining Form)|Shining Form]]

title: kamen_rider_kuuga
body:
Protagonist and sole Rider of [[kamen_rider_kuuga_(series)|Kamen Rider Kuuga]], tenth show of the Kamen Rider series and the first of the Heisei generation.

[[Godai Yuusuke]] is a free-spirited, multi-talented man said to possess 1,999 different skills, who, one day, finds an ancient relic which embeds itself into his body and allows him to transform into the fabled warrior Kuuga to fight the Grongi, monsters from an ancient civilization who kill people for sport.

Kuuga has multiple forms - the basic but very weak Growing Form (white), the balanced Mighty Form (red; default), the speed based and staff wielding Dragon Form (blue), the ranged based and gun wielding Pegasus Form (green), and the power based and sword wielding Titan Form (purple), as well as the upgraded, golden trimmed "Rising" forms for the latter four, the Amazing Mighty Form (black), and the most powerful but also the most dangerous, the Ultimate Form (also black), which has two eye colors: black if he loses control of himself or red if he retains his will.

h4. See also

* [[Arcle (Kuuga)|]] ([[Rider belt]])

title: pizzicato_polka
body: The game takes place in a town where a series of homicides have taken place. You play as main character [[Tatsuya Tsuzumi]] who has come to the town as an exchange student in order to search for his friend, whose whereabouts are unknown. While in town, you get close to a group of girls and begin to learn the true nature of the case plaguing the town.

title: typhoon_(kamen_rider)
body:
The first [[rider belt]] introduced in [[Kamen Rider]], used by [[Kamen Rider 1]] and [[Kamen Rider 2]].

2015's [[Kamen Rider 3]] and [[Kamen Rider 4]], being based on the originals, also use the Typhoon. Adaptations based on the [[kamen rider (1st series)|original Kamen Rider]], such as [[Kamen Rider the First]] and [[Shin Kamen Rider]], also feature their own iterations of the Typhoon, whether for their versions of No. 1 and No. 2, or for original characters such as [[Kamen Rider 0]].

title: kamen_rider_2
body:
The second protagonist of the [[kamen rider (1st series)|original]] [[Kamen Rider]] television series.

After [[kamen rider 1|Hongou Takeshi]]'s desertion of Shocker, [[Ichimonji Hayato]] is kidnapped and reconstructed into a cyborg with the sole purpose of eliminating Kamen Rider, but is rescued by Hongo before brainwashing could take place. Ichimonji is christened the second Kamen Rider and joins Hongo in his fight against Shocker.

Originally differentiated from No. 1 with his silver mouthpiece, he would receive red gloves and boots. In the continuity of [[Kamen Rider the First]], he is colored green with a red belt. In each adaptation of the original series, his eyes are rendered as red.

h4. Appearance

* !post #475341: Original, with [[kamen rider 1|No. 1]]
* !post #668115: Red gloves, with [[kamen rider 1|No. 1]]
* !post #6887478: [[Kamen Rider the First|The First]], with [[kamen rider 1|No. 1]]
* !post #6933973: [[Shin Kamen Rider|Shin]], with [[kamen rider 1 (shin)|No. 1]]

h4. See also

* [[Typhoon (Kamen Rider)|]] ([[Rider belt]])
* [[Kamen Rider 2 (Shin)|]] ([[Shin Kamen Rider]])

title: kamen_rider_1
body:
One of the two protagonists of the [[kamen rider (1st series)|original series]] that kicked off the [[Kamen Rider]] franchise.

[[Hongou Takeshi]] is kidnapped by the terrorist organization, Shocker, and surgically altered into a cyborg. Hongo, however, manages to escape before being brainwashed to do Shocker's bidding and uses his new power to begin his war against evil as the first Kamen Rider.

After the introduction of [[kamen rider 2|No. 2]], his gloves and boots are changed from green to white to avoid confusion. In the continuity of [[Kamen Rider the First]], he is dark blue with a white belt. In both the First continuity and in [[Shin Kamen Rider]], his eyes are rendered as whiter than No. 2's.

h4. Appearance

* !post #475341: Original, with [[kamen rider 2|No. 2]]

title: the_sorcerer's_apprentice
body:
[b]"The Sorcerer's Apprentice"[/b] (German: [i]"Der Zauberlehrling"[/i]) is a poem by Johann Wolfgang von Goethe written in 1797. The poem is a ballad in fourteen stanzas.

The Disney movies [i][[Fantasia (Disney)|]][/i] and [i]Fantasia 2000[/i] were based on this poem.

The story begins with an apprentice in magic who was given chores by an old sorcerer before leaving his workshop. As he grew tired of fetching water by pail, the apprentice enchanted a broom to do the work for him. Before long, the floor slowly began getting wet all over, and the apprentice realized that he cannot stop the broom from working because he didn't know the magic required to do so.

He split the broom with an axe to stop it, but each of the pieces it split into become a whole broom, resuming their task as normal. The room rapidly started flooding, and when it all seemed lost, the old sorcerer returned and quickly broke the spell. In the end, the old sorcerer stated that only a master should invoke powerful spirits.

h4. See also

* [[Broom (The Sorcerer's Apprentice)]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: The Sorcerer's Apprentice":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Sorcerer%27s_Apprentice]

title: disneyland
body:
Disneyland is the name applied to any of several of [[Disney]]'s [[amusement park|theme parks]] around the world, including the original in California.

[b]Tokyo Disneyland[/b] (東京ディズニーランド, Tōkyō Dizunīrando) is a 115 acre (465,000 m²) theme park at the Tokyo Disney Resort located in Urayasu, Chiba, Japan, near Tokyo. The park was constructed by Walt Disney Imagineering in the same style as Disneyland in California and Magic Kingdom in Florida. Also at Tokyo Disney Resort is [[Tokyo DisneySea]] (東京ディズニーシー, Tōkyō DizunīShī) and Ikspiari (イクスピアリ), the domestic equivalents of DisneySea and Downtown Disney.

There are seven themed areas in the park: the World Bazaar; the four classic Disney lands: Adventureland, Westernland, Fantasyland and Tomorrowland; and two mini-lands: Critter Country and Mickey's Toontown. The park is noted for its extensive open spaces, to accommodate the large crowds that visit the park. In 2009, Tokyo Disneyland hosted approximately 13.65 million guests, ranking it as the third-most visited theme park in the world, behind its American sister parks, Magic Kingdom and Disneyland.

h4. Disneyland attractions

* [[Chandu]]

title: ceras_yanagida_lilienfeld
body:
A [[virtual youtuber|virtual school idol]] and member of [[Link! Like! Love Live!]]'s [[Edel Note]] from the 105th graduating class, first introduced as a third year at [[mizukawa school uniform|Mizukawa Girls' Middle School]].

She loves school idols, and is always thinking about them, even during class. She craves attention and is a bit clingy. Originally from [[Nagano prefecture|Nagano]], she was friends with [[Hinoshita Kaho]] from their time in the hospital together, and call each other “hospi-pals.” She enjoys playing the [[violin]], but according to her, it’s nothing more than a hobby.

She has [[long hair|long]] [[grey hair]] with [[swept bangs]] and [[blue eyes]]. Her hair is decorated with [[pink ribbon|pink]] [[hair ribbon]]s behind each ear. Viewers have observed that she has a [[large breasts|pretty sizable bust]].

Kaho calls her "Secchan," while she calls Kaho "Hana-chan."

Voiced by [[Miyake Miu]].

title: spiked_hair
body:
A term used to describe a variety of hairstyles in which the hair is formed into spikes. This hairstyle is largely seen on male characters from Shōnen manga and anime, though it is sometimes seen on females as well.

It is a youthful, messy and wild hairstyle. The artist [[Toriyama Akira]] was particularly known for his spiky-haired character designs, particularly in [[Dragon Ball Z]], where by the end of the series every protagonist even remotely relevant had some form of this hairstyle.

h6. Notable characters:

* [[Cloud Strife]] (from [[Final Fantasy VII]])
* [[ryouko_(tenchi_muyou!)|Ryouko]] (from [[tenchi_muyou!|Tenchi Muyou!]])
* [[Son Goku]] (from [[Dragon Ball]])
* [[Uzumaki Naruto]] (from [[Naruto]])
* [[Kamijou Touma]] (from [[Toaru Majutsu no Index]])

h4. See Also

* [[Tag Group:Hair Styles]]

title: futaba_kominato
body:
This is one of the variations of [[futaba_minato|Futaba Minato]].
The design is based on the image of “幼い(young)”, one of the six emotional values of the CeVIO AI Talkvoice.

She has a childlike appearance, with [[twintails]] hair, blue [[soverall_shorts|overalls short]] over a white laced [[shirt]], and [[socks]] with a cat print on them.
Also, there are various stickers and accessories on her [[randoseru]]. (see reference sheet).

title: nasal_helmet
body: A type of combat [[helmet]] characterised by the possession of a projecting bar covering the nose and thus protecting the centre of the face; it was of Western European origins and was used from the late 9th century to at least c. 1250. ("Wikipedia":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nasal_helmet)

title: princess_zelda
body:
The titular character of [i][[the Legend of Zelda]][/i] series. Although the details of her background can vary in different games, Zelda is (almost) always depicted as the daughter of the royal family of Hyrule, and is the possessor and guardian of the [[Triforce]] of Wisdom.

Depictions of Zelda have varied over the years, but her most common character designs show her with [[blonde hair]] or [[brown hair]], [[blue eyes]] or [[green eyes]], [[pointy ears]], and a [[gown]] of white and lavender with gold accents, often decorated with [[Triforce]] symbols and other Hyrulian iconography. She is usually depicted as being the same age as [[Link]], the child protagonist of the games, or slightly older; a few games have shown her as a young adult woman.

title: riffa
body:
R.I.F.F.A are characters in [[IDOLMASTER XENOGLOSSIA]].
* Height 149cm
* Weight 36kg
* BWH measurements: 53-48-55
* Age: 9 years old
* Blood type: Unknown
* Favourite food: [[lollipop]]
* Boarding iDOL: Epimetheus.
* Voice: [[Yukana]]

They are characterised by light [[blonde hair]] and [[light blue eyes]].
They are often dressed in a [[long_sleeves|long-sleeved]] white and light blue [[dress]], [[white kneehighs]] and [[black shoes]].
They have superhuman physical abilities and can jump several metres into the air, swing and throw a large [[axe]] with one hand.
They are called ‘Bastards’, who have both iDOL and human elements.

[spoiler]They were produced from the eggs of [[Miura Azusa (idolmaster xenoglossia)|Miura Azusa]]. 
As this article refers to ‘they’, there are dozens of R.I.F.F.As.
Ultimately, they were all killed off.[/spoiler]

title: shauntal_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Shauntal[/b], known as [b]Shikimi[/b] (シキミ) in Japan, is a character introduced in [i][[pokemon|Pokémon]] [[pokemon bw|Black and White]][/i].

While she is one of the Unova Pokémon League's Elite Four, she is also a novelist who sometimes uses Trainers who challenge her as material for her books.

She has [[purple eyes]] and [[purple hair]] with [[blunt bangs]]. She wears [[glasses]], a [[purple dress]], [[black pantyhose]], [[mary janes]], and carries a [[book]] and [[pen]].

title: gladiia_(arknights)
body:
[i]Rhodes Island Ægir Affairs Officer-in-Charge Gladiia, now inclined to divulge some information to you.[/i]

A playable Specialist Operator in [[Arknights]]. 

h4. Profile
[expand]
[table]
[tbody]
      [tr][td]Place of Birth:[/td]
      [td]Ægir[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Birthday:[/td]
      [td]November 6[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Race:[/td]
      [td]Undisclosed[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Height:[/td]
      [td]181 cm[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Combat Experience:[/td]
      [td]17 years[/td][/tr]
  [/tbody]
[/table]
[/expand]

An Aegir technology consul, honorary army leader, the chief combat strategist of the Abyssal Hunters, and Rhodes Island's heads of Aegir affairs.

Her motif is based on [[Swordfish]].

Her [[voice actor]]s are [[Nabatame Hitomi]] (Japanese), Huang Ying (Chinese), Ashleigh Haddad (English), and Lee Myung-hee (Korean). Her art designer is [[chuzenji]].

title: cabbage
body:
An edible plant, eaten as a [[vegetable]].
Take note in the appearance of a cabbage, large heads of compact leaves-round or elongated. There is a thick stalk running from the bottom of the cabbage to the top leaves.

Though often cooked, cabbage can be used raw for fermented recipes.

title: berserker_(fate/zero)
body:
[[Fate/Zero]] character.

A towering man clad in black-bluish [[full armor|full plate armor]], wearing a plumed [[helmet]] that conceals his face. Sometimes he's depicted with his helmet off, with [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] and a gaunt face.

[b]True Name:[/b] [[Lancelot (fate/zero)|]]. He also has a [[Fate/Grand Order]] incarnation where he fights under the [[Lancelot (fate/grand order)|Saber]] designation.

For tagging purposes, only also tag [[Lancelot (Fate/Zero)]] if it's clearly his original appearance in the Berserker armor or both appear in the image. Not all helmetless depictions of Berserker are his original version. Some of the differences between the two can be seen in asset #23661650.

Not to be mistaken with [[Heracles (fate)|]].

title: furina_(genshin_impact)
body:
A playable hydro character in [[Genshin Impact]]. She is the human vessel of the Hydro Archon Focalors, the God of Justice.
She is voiced by [[Minase Inori]] (Japanese) and [[Amber Lee Connors (voice actor)|]] (English).

She has [[white hair|white]] and [[blue hair]] that is either worn in a [[long hair|long]] [[ponytail]] or cut [[short hair|short]], a large [[ahoge]] and [[heterochromia|heterochromatic]] [[blue eyes]] with [[mismatched pupils|mismatched]] [[drop-shaped pupils]]. She is dressed in a blue [[ouji fashion]] outfit with a [[top hat]].

Her signature weapon is [[Splendor of Tranquil Waters (genshin Impact)|]].

title: united_states
body:
An image referencing the United States of America, most commonly showing the [[American flag]], depicting [[real world location]]s or [[politician]]s, or making jokes about American culture or American [[patriotism]].

The United States of America (commonly known as the United States, US, USA, or America), is a country primarily located in North America. It shares land borders with [[Canada]] to its north and with [[Mexico]] to its south and has maritime borders with the [[Bahamas]], [[Cuba]], [[Russia]], and other nations. Its national language is [[english_text|English]], though there is no legally official language except in some individual US states.

Do not apply this tag if the character is simply wearing [[American flag print]] clothing, unless the post explicitly references American culture in general.

title: nissan_skyline
body:
A sedan by [[Nissan]], made most famous through its [[nissan skyline gt-r|GT-R]] sports variant.

Several generations of the Skyline have been sold outside of Japan, through most of the foreign releases are rebadged and drop the Skyline branding. Generations 3-5 were sold as [[Datsun]] models in export markets, while the 11th generation (V35) and on are sold under the [[Infiniti (company)|]] label in America, Europe, Korea, Taiwan, and the Middle East.

title: demon_core
body:
A plutonium [[orb|sphere]] that was meant to be used as a core of a third [[nuclear weapon|atomic bomb]] of [[Fat Man (bomb)|]] design to be dropped on Japan. However, after Japan's surrender, the third bomb was never assembled, and the core was later studied at Los Alamos Laboratory, USA.

The core would later gain the name "Demon core" after two separate criticality accidents, each of which killed one scientist. The second incident involved Louis Slotin, a Canadian-American physicist, using a [[screwdriver]] to control the separation of two metallic half spheres (neutron reflectors) around the core. Upon the screwdriver slipping out, the half spheres closed completely and the assembly immediately became supercritical, releasing a burst of [[radiation]], more specifically [[Cherenkov radiation]]. This procedure specifically has became a subject of several minor memes in the Japanese community, usually to suggest a character is habitually oblivious or reckless.

In 2022, a [[meme]] revolving around the Demon Core suddenly became popular outside of Japan, possibly due to "Kyle Hill's":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aFlromB6SnU] and "Plainly Difficult's":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VE8FnsnWz48] videos covering the object. Several artists and animators have created works involving various characters replicating Slotin's experiment.

h4. See also

* [[Cherenkov radiation]] - the blue light emitted from the Demon core while going supercritical

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Demon core":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Demon_core

title: sakuragi_miria
body:
Character from [[Game Club Project]]. After receiving a new voice in 2019 and the disbanding of the group in 2021, Miria continued her virtual career through the agency Highway Star, along with fellow Unlimited coworker [[Claire Cruller]]. She graduated on May 17th, 2025.

title: mobile_suit_gundam:_ex_revue
body:
[b]Mobile Suit Gundam: EX Revue[/b] is a 1994 2D competitive fighting [[arcade]] [[video game]] developed by Allumer and published by Banpresto only in [[Japan]]. 

The game can be played in English or Japanese, suggesting that Banpresto might have planned to release this game internationally. 

EX Revue is based on the [[GUNDAM]] franchise and is an updated and retitled version of the 1993 [[Mobile Suit Gundam]] arcade game.

title: zeta_gundam_(mobile_suit)
body:
The [b]MSZ-006 Zeta Gundam[/b] is the first transformable lead Gundam-type [[mobile suit]] [[mecha]] in the entire [[Gundam]] franchise, and the titular mobile suit of [[zeta_gundam|Mobile Suit Zeta Gundam]]. It also appears in the [[Gundam ZZ]] sequel series.

The Ζeta's design was revolutionary in many ways (both in and out of the anime), and in the UC timeline looked very different from previous models of the Gundam type of Mobile Suit. One example of the physical difference is that the Zeta has a ventless mouthpiece and a white, sharp chin. This head design is also present in some mobile suits of the Project Zeta such as the [[S Gundam]]. The transformation ability and the suit's great speed is its signature quality, as its transformation is fluid and integrated into its combat style often giving it grace unrivaled by most MS. 

The Zeta Gundam transforms into a fighter-like form called the [[wave rider|Waverider]] Mode. This grants the Zeta not only enhanced speed and mobility, but also the ability to make an atmospheric re-entry from [[space]] on its own without the aid of ballute packs or other external re-entry systems. With the Zeta Gundam's powerful Biosensor activated, the Waverider Mode can be used as a deadly weapon called the [[Waverider Crash]].

This mobile suit has many pilots for the record, but is famously known to be designed and piloted by [[Kamille Bidan]] during [[zeta_gundam|The Gryps War]]. [spoiler]Kamille used the remains of [[Quattro Bajeena]]'s red [[Rick Dias]] and parts of a [[Gundam Mk II]] to develop the Zeta.[/spoiler]

During [[gundam_zz|The First Neo Zeon War]] it was piloted by [i][[Gundam Team]][/i] member [[Roux Louka]]. [spoilers]The unit was damaged and destroyed during the final battle of that war, while its design data was sealed off by the [[Earth Federation]] government for reasons unknown.[/spoilers]

In [[real life]], it is designed by [[Fujita Kazumi]] and its transformation planned by [[Ookawara Kunio]].

h4.Related development
* [[Prototype Zeta Gundam X1]]

title: mobile_suit_gundam_katana
body:
[b]Mobile Suit Gundam Katana[/b] is a graphic novel serialized in [[Gundam Ace]] (2009), set during [b]U.C. 0084[/b]. 

It is the sequel to [[Mobile Suit Gundam: We're Federation Hooligans!!]]. It is notable for featuring many rare [[mobile suit]] [[mecha]]nical designs that only appeared previously in [[video game]]s.

h4.Some featured MS
* [[Dolmel]]
** [[Dolmel Doue]]
other_names: 機動戦士ガンダムカタナ

title: dolmel
body:
A fictional antagonist manned combat robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. It appears in the 90s competitive fighting arcade [[video game]] [[Mobile Suit Gundam: EX Revue]] and the manga [[Mobile Suit Gundam Katana]].

[b]MS-19 Dolmel[/b]

A very rare experimental prototype [[mobile suit]] of the [[zeon|Principality of Zeon]] designed for Raid attacks and CQC. 

It is one of the mobile suits developed for decisive battles at the end of [[mobile_suit_gundam|The One Year War]]. The Dolmel was developed in secret at an arsenal in [[A Baoa Qu]], and is said to be a machine that boasts a high level of perfection. 

It used a sophisticated high-capacity reactor to power the large number of thrusters and vernier thrusters that gave the machine a great amount of mobility. This MS also has many built-in armaments, but information about them is scarce. 

The Dolmel is said to be a "phantom mobile suit" and most of the information and research of it was lost after the war.

h4.Related development
* [[Dolmel Doue]]

title: mad_scienstein
body:
A comical character originally appearing in [[Kaeru no Tame ni Kane wa Naru]] (translated to "The Frog For Whom the Bell Tolls") before crossing over to appear in [[Wario Land 3]] & [[Dr. Mario 64]] as an enemy, and [[Wario Land 4]] as a supporting character. 

He has a white [[mustache]], [[beard]] and [[coke-bottle glasses|swirly glasses]]. In Wario Land 3 he wears a  dome [[helmet]] surrounded by glass and wears a [[lab coat]] befitting a scientist, while in Wario Land 4 he reverts back to the bald head that is shaped like a butt and is a wearing [[brown coat]] and [[brown pants|pants]] befitting an archaeologist. 

In Wario Land 3 & Dr. Mario 64 his Japanese name is [b]Mad Stein[/b] (マッドシタイン) while in Kaeru no Tame ni Kane wa Naru & Wario Land 4 it's [b]Arewo Shitain-hakase[/b] (アレヲ・シタイン博士).

h4#single-color-themes. Single color themes

Used for content featuring a specific dominant color.

* 1. Includes [[monochrome]] images of that color
** Does not include the colors black, white, or grey, which only use the [[greyscale]] tag
* 2. Images where a large number of items in the image are that color
** Example: when the subject is dressed primarily or entirely in clothes of that color.
